Entry.1:
commencing New diary defence Pay 51&pound-7-0 
Owe me 68/6 off Tomorrow morning thank Heaven 
might get a little rest now been under shell fire 122 days.
Entry.2:
Hot clear morning, the gun fire very heavy last night, Boys came out without a casualty & are gone on further today. Am left in charge of Packs & will take them by Motor Lorry later on. 

 Huns have taken 25000 Prisoners & am on the outskirts of Rheims this can be expected & worse before it gets better. deferred pay £57-8-6 owe me 70/6 Upat 1/4/56 Lorry arrived at 12 as per usual had to make two trips got a ride in last one about 5 miles, its a deserted Village not knocked about much yet two small Lakes & plenty of lovely Trees & a fine chateau. Fritz shells & Bombs round about They tell me the name is Pont Razelle came through Querrier very hot night, had to go & put up tents for C-G & officers at 9 PM. Mosquitos Bad
Entry.3: Another lovely day, not a shell or Bomb here last night. What a relief after such a lot of it, going for swim today deferred Pay£51-10-0 owe me 72/6 had a swim & am awfully tired after it the first since leaving Egypt 2 years ago. Water very cold but sun hot. 6 Pm The church Bell is ringing & sounds strange after being away so long from them. Almost all the churches I have seen have been just Rubble & dust. We dont hear the guns here so much but they shake the house like an earthquake especially the 12". Some poor old women are going to church. this is Sunday. Heavens how France has lost its Population. We have been in hundreds of Villages & Towns & no civilians there. A few old women prefer to die sooner than be shifted, so awfully sad. two days gone out of the 10 to men been working Putting up round officers Tents fine spell for men who have just done 122 days in the lines
Entry.4: Been very busy today Court of inquiry on all day was court orderly Cpl. Missing men are located in this court or tried to.. Just finished for tea, after had to pack up & shift again into a wood across the canal. it’s a lovely place but damp & mosquitos by the trillion. got letter from Bank saying 15£- there for me "do that leave" also Parcel from Wagga Wagga 2nd from Yarella Comfort club. God Bless them all. Am writing to them tomorrow 2 shirts 2 pr sox tobac & cig Papers. Batch Buttons, Laces, etc. deferred Pay 51£-11-6. owe me 74/6
Entry.5: Rather cool last night & mosquitos well – this is a lovely spot every kind of tree Oak, Beech, Elm, Chestnut & ornamental. A lake on each side of us & two small canals. Boys swimming all day. Only one thing wrong with it Fritz shells it & bombs it & tree leaves wont keep out his ironmongery. cloudy but fine. Pay Books collected – deferred Pay 51&pound-13-0 owe me 76/6
Entry.6: Beautiful morning sun shining, hot, nice Breeze blowing, 3rd Div went over this morning no news yet. Artillery going like mad 3.a.m. Pay today. deferred Pay 51&pound-14-6 Owe me 78/6. have written to Nell, Tony, Carol, Syd, Jessie Nip & the Sec Yarella C.fund. Paid 70 francs. 51/4 Bal. to me to date. 28/- Wrote to Viv have not posted any yet. Been inoculated.
Entry.7: glorious morning, arm very stiff & sore, water sport this afternoon some fun I guess. Jerry hovered over us for over half an hour last night fully expected him to drop them, but he did not let them go here, some came down close, in the village of Quensieu. The other morning he came over on the 2nd Div: but got cut up. deferred Pay £57-16-0 owe me 30/-, been through the gas to test masks. hear we are going in again in 3 days time Posted all my letters 9 in all. Put some Post Cards in Syds & Jims. sports just starting. Reinforcements arrived at 1-30 P.m.
Entry.8: Another fine day but clouding up like thunderstorm had to put the Blankets through the fumigator this morning nothing of any interest to put down,, no leave yet. deferred Pay £51-17-6 Owe me 32/- Jerry’s flying over us this morning . feeling a bit dopy yet from inoculation the 54th are having their swimming carnival today & theres hell to play go on Bill go on Tom etc. war--why you wouldnt think such a thing was on except now & then a shell comes in Najelle about 300 yds behind us. got an attack of diarroehea there two days
Entry.9: cloudy & cool like rain/ guns very quiet yesterday & last night have not heard one this morning too cloudy for planes last night. Plenty of drilling going on etc sports in a day or so deferred Pay £57-19-0 Owe me 34/- 53rd having their sports today Band Playing. Wanted me to play cricket today but not today next day a tale no news of going back yet tonight Brigadier there
Entry.10: Another lively morning, fierce bombardment all along our front from Villers Bretonneux all about. Kept it going for two or three hours Fritz sent some long distance shells over us about 1.am. One side or the other went on last night but no news yet of church service for the fallen today. deferred Pay £52-0-6 owe me 36/- Fritz came over last night in massed formation in the 4th Div but got cut to Pieces did not get near our front trench even. Hot morning but cold this evening. Raining. Wrote to Nell & sent cards of Aubigny & Villers Bretonneux
Entry.11:
Raining cold & Bleak. Held Quarters Parade on this morning Posted Nells letter. Expect we go back again to the line in a day or so. deferred Pay £52-2-0 Owe me 38/- fined up during the afternoon but cold night

Tuesday 11/6/18

Cool but fine morning. Terrific Barrage put up last night at 9.30 Fritz came over & we could see it was a clash 

a lot of wounded also a lot of 4th Divy wounded have not heard yet how our Boys got on but the guns are still going it & Fritz was shelling the Road right back here just now deferred pay £52-3-6 owe me 40/- Heard that 2nd Divy captured 217 Prisoners & 22 machine guns
Entry.12: Divy 1 Gun & 18 Prisoners not too bad. Guns still dealing it out 2 Pm. Dzns of Planes up overhead last night but no bombs dropped near here. Am going round Companies this afternoon with Beer acting as Barman wonder how my head will feel tonight
Entry.13:
fine morning but cloudy suspect it will turn out hot

the Artillery has quietened down so our chaps must have held what they took. Hun Prisoners not too good looking some old & Bent some very young & some all right their casualties must have been pretty large as prisoners were taken from 3 div/s. Moving Tomorrow I hear. deferred Pay £52-5-0 owe me 42/- had a swim this morning pretty cold but lovely after a time the Inoculation made one too queer to take it on sooner. Operatives are slambing into their trench over and Montidur expect this will be his next move
Entry.14: Still here & no news when going the longer the better as this is a delightful spot. Fine & going to be hot. The Artillery has been having a rest for 24 hours deferred Pay £52-6-6 Owe me 44/- Get about 1 Pint of Beer a day since 6. Another escort today have them every day now & will have for some time. Payday in two days but not drawing anything this time have 50 left yet. A namesake of mine gone on leave to Blighty thank heaven its started at last may get mine any day now
Entry.15:
Cool & cloudy, like rain, Fritz sent over some rubber heels last night & again this morning about 3-30.

landed a couple very close to two of my men on Water Point duty Just been down to see them. Put one between our two bridges also & knocked a house down in the Village alongside some french women who are still staying here. 54th moved this morning we go Tomorrow deferred Pay £52-8-0 Owe me 46/- fun all over now & the Butchery to start again:
Entry.16: Cool & cloudy light rain about 3-30 am; sun coming out Pay day, but not drawing any must save up for good time in Blighty. deferred pay £52-9-6 owe me 48/-. quiet night last night no rubber Heels over & few Planes , expected the hun over but did not come. Posted letters & cards to Nell. COs Orders today 9 of them. Kept my cool all day.
Entry.17: lovely hot morning of course, because we are moving & packed up like camels. Going a mile or so nearer the line thats all hardly worth shifting Quiet night again fritz was expected over last night our Planes very busy deferred Pay £52-11-0. Owe me 50/-. Off at 9 a m. through to Bonnay & dug-outs on the side of the hill about 7 kilos, told us we were going about 1 ½ liars . cloudy & has been very hot. have got Bosker dug-out Box Table & good bed of ground write to Mrs Parsons . To Bed 10 Pm pretty tired
Entry.18: up at ¼ to 7 feeling fine had good nights rest not much gun fire altho they are behind us now instead of in front like other camp. Jerry been up & over us this morning but he does not come far Our planes up by the doz deferred Pay £52-12-6 Owe me 52/-
Entry.19: lovely morning & very busy shifting into another dug out last one too small but good had to crawl into it like a worm this one OK. filled large chaff bag with grass for mattress. Jerry slinging his ironmongery all over the place this morning big Barrage on over left last night he is bursting high explosive scrapnell over our heads now & it does make a din. deferred Pay £52-14-0 Owe me 54/- getting some comforts fund stuff Yesterday 25 cigs a man, Oatmeal, & cocoa & milk by 9 to a tin. Today fruit tin to 9 milk tin to 6 Biscuits Pkt. to 8. Fritz shelling hill out of that Heilly Village & trenches near it, Heavy Black clouds again get them every night
Entry.20: Raining hard & has been during the night, not a gun barking would hardly think there was a war on. thank goodness my dug-out is water-tight so far this will be a good day for letter writing deferred Pay £52-15-6. Owe me 56/- write to Syd & Nell & Mrs Parsons & Comfort fund. Letters from (2) Both the same 1 Mr Barker 1 Nell 1 Jack
Entry.21: Rain stopped but cloudy nice breeze blowing quiet last night posted letters to Syd, Nell & Mrs Parsons. deferred Pay £52-17-0 Owe me 58/- wrote to Viv. Been cloudy all day & showery Raining now 6.30Pm the 9.2s are trying to break our ear drums.
Entry.22: Showery still but nice & cool going for bath & clean change to day. guns opened up at 3-30 this morning but not for long Yankee Officer sent up Past him Just now wonder if they are taking over, hear we are going out for spell shortly. deferred Pay £52-10-6. Owe me 60/- longest day in the Year soon get shorter again, Pat came back yesterday. Had a Bath etc. Will write to Mr Lorrie about Tony. Beastly night scotch mist just the night fritz likes to come over Guns very quiet no visibility
Entry.23: Rained heavy last night & some more to come strong wind blowing Artillery pretty busy during the early Part of last night. Great rumours about our going out for long spell 90 days some say & 6 weeks others. hope so anyway may get my leave then. deferred Pay £53- Owe me 62/-. Pat away on Escort again Doug Meagher this time. Goulanville.
Entry.24: Still blowing a gale heavy clouds & cold 15th Brig had a couple of raids last night don’t know how they got on. Church parade this morning for C of E. deferred Pay £53-1-6. Owe me 64/- wind dropped a bit much warmer this afternoon, had a game of cricket. Went to Church Parade this morning
Entry.25:
Heavy clouds & blowing great guns again this place rivals Wellington N.Z. for wind Posted letters to Maude 

& Viv deferred Pay £53-3-0 Amount due to me 66/- dreamt I was in Blighty last night & what a time I was having. New rumour that we are here till end of month then going up the front for 15 days. 

wrote to Arthur about Tony. also to Nell & Tony Postcards. Posted them. Been windy all day & ended up in rain, cooler now at last but t more rain about. 7-30 Pm. Going to front line Wednesday. Foggy night & cold.
Entry.26:
Heavy fog last night but nice fine & warm day moving tomorrow night into frontline. Italians had splendid victory 12,000 Prisoners & advanced 40 kilos fritz your done, its the beginning of the end.

deferred Pay. £53-4-6. Amt owing me 68/-. Italians doing fine captured 28,000 accounted for 180,000 took 75 Planes & 6 Baloons, intact & Austrian cabinet has resigned Hooray.
Entry.27:
off tonight me with those into supports wonder what luck this time

 anyway have written to them all deferred pay £53-6-0 owe me 70/- Rained last night & very cold this morning fine & warm with heavy clouds fritz pelted a lot of shells over us at day-Break this morning made my dug-out tremble thought they were bombs at first. Packed up & ready to go up the line great activity getting Packs Packed & started by 10.a.m. As per usual the very last moment am sent out to look after Packs, Guard & Prisoner. Got here La Houssrie about 12. long walk all uphill. Had to stack all the packs & Officers Valises also Q.master for course. Busy day am Jolly tired.
Entry.28: Slept like a top surrounded by Packs & Valises 54 men out here including Band. Lovely morning but a cold snap in the air am afraid there wont be a long summer. deferred Pay £:53-7-6 – 72/-. One wounded going in last night. Nice hot day Am camped in an old barn with nearly all the roof gone so if it rains Packs & I get wet. Italians have taken 45,000 Prisoners, Again Hooray. Out in the back is an orchard. Apples not ripe yet. Jerry Put up great Barrage on our planes going over this Afternoon seems to be something doing.
Entry.29: fritz’s Planes over last night bombing everywhere, Contay got it bad also this place & down by the guns but he kept away from here altho he dropped dzs just behind us near the horse lines no sleep till he finished about 1.a.m. Lovely morning again sun getting very hot. deferred Pay £ 53-9-0 – 74/- some men going on leave no word about mine.
Entry.30: lovely hot morning again this is France at her best the cuckoos are making a great noise in the woods also all the other birds. Big Bombardment last night must have been at hipour. Fritz’s planes over here bombing again no sleep while they are around. Mail in but nothing for me. deferred Pay. £ 53-10-6 76/- Been doing some washing Pants especially Boiled them for ½ an hour to kill chats Eggs only way am wandering round in little linen under Pants come about half way to my knees and decidedly chilly shirts & sox; Tomorrow another shirt & towel. This the 2nd Anniversary of our landing in France
Entry.31: Another beautiful morning Fritz’s shells are flying round & last night his planes were out strong dropping eggs. did not go to bed till 11 no use as you cant go to sleep with them hovering over you & expecting a bomb any minute. Things seem to be getting more lively down here & I think something is in the wind. A poor chap was brought in on a limber, dead, last night killed by Bomb two nights ago. he is going to be buried now. Wrote to Nell yesterday & Posted it. deferred Pay £53-12-0 78/- This time two years ago was in the Train from Marseilles that lovely trip I shall never forget.
Entry.32: Hot fine morning but the nights are getting cold with suspicion of frost in the air Our chaps got terrible Bombardment 2 hours. Trenches smashed to bits had to evacuate for some hours. 4 dead & 4 wounded marvel how they got out of it Jerry over again last night in swarms. deferred Pay £ 55-13-6 80/- did some more washing today
Entry.33: fine hot morning Jerry’s Planes were about last night for the first time since I came here, must have been giving the back areas a time of it. The usual bombardment up to about 12 midnight deferred Pay £53-15-0 82/- Wrote to Mr Barker.
Entry.34:
Cold, cloudy, & like heavy rain coming Knew it by my rheumatic Pains in legs & feet. Terrific Bombardment last night round Albert lasted about 3 hours. Tomorrow is supposed to be the start of our offensive. Turned out fine after all but cold wind blowing. Guns Banging away big hop over tonight or tomorrow morning from Villers Bretonneux to Albert about 40 kilos. our boys going over for a Raid, Yanks, Tommies & French a big hop over so then will be a nice raid –shortly its now 7-30 P.m. Had a game of cricket today made 13 first innings 0 second. 

too old for that sort of thing. Have to go to bed to get warm & this is midwinter The sun sets ½ an hour earlier now soon have winter again. deferred Pay £53-16-6 – 84/-
Entry.35:
Heavy clouds & cold morning. The bombardment started at 3 a.m. & was awful get up to see it & it was a great sight for 15 or 20 miles the country was one sheet of flame & I would not like to have been on Fritzs side of the fence Particulars in yet. 4th Div still fighting. 

9am. Am going out to watch for the hun Prisoners. Deferred Pay £53-18-0 - 86/- all sorts of rumours as to what the Boys took 

we had 200 go over in a Raid. Wrote to Viv & Posted it. Played 54th again & won. won 2 lost 1. Turned out nice & warm this afternoon, but cool again at night. Bombardment started by Fritz at dusk.
Entry.36: Another anxious night Fritz came over on the 15th Brig. & 4th Divi but got cut to pieces our barrage simply awful, he sent his planes over bombing & altogether it was a little hell. Yesterday 4th Divi took 960 Prisoners 95 machine guns 4 minnies & one 77 m.m. gun & 15 officers. 15th Brig. 60 Prisoners our chaps 1 prisoner 1 machine gun our casualties about 80. Lt Stafford killed & Lt Piddington also killed 10 altogether. deferred pay £53-19-6 - 88/-
Entry.37: Heavy clouds this morning but turned out fine brought in the dead men this morning Lft. Piddington terribly knocked about Lft. Stafford buried up there Our casualties more than expected about 12 killed including 2 officers & about 30 wounded & some still missing. The raid an awful Balls up. Stokes mortars dropped short amongst our men hence the casualty list. Egan Lou’s old friend killed. Gerr Isedale who went through that night at Norielle with me also. Ted O’Neill wounded, Cpl Cole wnd. cpl Holliday killed. Nugget Dalton wnd. etc. all old hands. deferred Pay £54-1-0 - 90/- latest is that Prisoners number 1600, 103 machine guns 7 field guns (77 m.m.s) & only 80 casualties in all the 4th Divi. We took one prisoner & 2 machine guns & had about 70 casualties. P’cards to Nell Jack Col & Tony.
Entry.38:
Nice hot morning flies very bad Blow flies as black as egypt by the million if this hot weather lasts there will be an epidemic of some sort break out Rumoured that enteric has got the hun bad. Some fierce counter attacks last night & this morning about 3am. no news yet 

Another poor chap brought in last night to be buried. deferred Pay £54-2-6. - 92/- Lt Stafford & cpl Sid Holliday’s bodies not recovered yet. Boys only out for 10 days in reserve about ½ Bat/ strong now, if that. At Messines we were the strongest Bat/ in A.I.F. Got Ted O’Neils Safety Razor Put his books in Pannier. Bill Harvey was amongst those killed & terribly smashed up at that. Lt Stafford & Batman met 3 huns the Lt/ shot 2 then the remaining one shot him & Batman shot the hun. Wrote to Syd
Entry.39: Very hot again this morning, great hustle lot of the Boys going to Paris for big review Paid today 70 francs £ 2-11-4 Balance owing to me £2-2-8 deferred. Pay p£54-4-0 3rd divi supposed to have gone over this morning no details yet. great gun fire 3.a.m. These Packs will drive me dilly Yet no sleep at night & going all day. Hottest day I have felt this year ended up with thunderstorm & Bombardment the two making a fine row.
Entry.40:
fine cool morning after storm The usual two Bombardments last night & this morning. Boys going into line again tonight about 400 strong

still they keep sending Officers & men to schools. time we got some heads in our Divi/ A nice chance we would stand in holding the line if the offensive starts here nothing but downright foolery & incompetence I think. Kept going day & night getting Packs & Valises out for men & officers going either on leave or to schools. If it wasn’t for the guns & the dead & wounded would swear I was at some huge Picnic. deferred Pay £54-5-6 - 44/8 3 letters from Nell 1 Jack 1 Tony 1 Arthur & 1 from Viv written at sea 27/5/17. Got rude awakening from our nice safe Posi here at dinner time Fritz got one of his long range guns on to us & caused us an anxious time while he got 7 shells over two of them pretty close & what a row they made just skimming over this place. Heavy storm coming up. Great Bombardment on our right been on for 5 hours now
Entry.41: lovely fresh morning after the storm rained hard for a while & came through this Roof of holes. Lot more came out yesterday going to schools & a lot went in, but we are fearfully weak at the front. deferred Pay £54-7-0 - 46/8. Have written to Capt Cotterill for my discharge goes through him to the C.B. then to Brigade then Div’s then Army Corps so should hear about it in 12 months time. (We’ll see.) Been raining again, no shooting from Fritz today. too cloudy.
Entry.42: clear, cool morning but clouds about more rain I suppose. Had a trip to Freshencourt to Court Martial our case remanded, useless brutes, 54th had a dig there if in handcuffs. Playing 8th Brigade cricket today but not me get too stiff afterwards hardly over the other game yet. Wrote to Nell & cards to Boys yesterday also Paper an Aussie. deferred Pay £54-8-6 - 48/8. Heavy thunderstorm never heard such peculiar thunder from start to finish one long growl never stopped lasted about 15 to 20 minutes quite cold this morning.
Entry.43: been raining but clearing now, terrific gun fire on our far right French must be either attacking or repulsing been at it over 4 or 5 hours perhaps its the big push. deferred Pay £54-10-0 - 50/8.
Entry.44: Posted letters to Syd, Nell, Arthur, Miss Byrne & Paper to Jack also PCds. Still cloudy & showery big battle yesterday between the huns & the French no particulars yet. Got a bad head today had about 7 whiskeys last night first for 12 months & I think the last for another 12. deferred Pay £54-11-6 - 52/8 sending all spare men into the line. fritz brought down two of our Baloons one after the other this afternoon & got away scot free 4 men jumped out in time & came down in their parachutes. Motor lorries by the doz going up tonight also gas, must be something doing.
Entry.45: cloudy still, fritz over again this morning but altho the antes fired about 500 shots at him he got away nothing occurred last night so it must have been put off. deferred Pay £54-13-0 - 54/8 feeling better this morning no more whisk for me.
Entry.46:
fine but cloudy, very hot, means more rain, rained heavily yesterday afternoon. fritz was expected over this morning but so far nothing doing

two fellows Kleinm & Dunker nearly burnt to death last night put Gelnt on to boiler thinking it was water & up she went, both in hospital badly burnt. deferred Pay £54-13-0 - 54/8 Boys coming out on the 17th Very hot. rumoured that fritz came over on 45 mile front south.
Entry.47: woke at 5 a.m. terrific thunderstorm one of the worst I have seen water poured through the holes in the roof so nothing fo rit but get up. have got tins of all kinds trying to catch it , but Packs & Valises are soaked looks like rain all day. deferred Pay £54-14-6 - 56/8. was forgetting the name of our front "Moolancourt". 3 of our baloons down on fire & 6 of fritzs cost about £1200 to 1500 each. very hot day like Sydney in Feb but turned cooler this evening a magnificent sunset, more chaps gone on leave.
Entry.48:
lovely morning, cool so far, rained a little during the night, but did not hear it. Boys come out today for 24 hours. then in till the 28th then out for long spell & dam near time too. Deferred Pay £54-16-0 - 58/8.

heavy gun fire last night all along the front from Bretonneux to Albert. 

no news of the Push yet. Big Bombardment all along Somme front as last night very intense also thunderstorm, awful row, sunset magnificent.
Entry.49: lovely morning cool & fine Artillery kept it up last night till after 12 fritz sending over heavy shells near us this morning pieces falling all round us. Day cleared out of the line again & gave himself up last night here. Mr Horne & Mr Wren back again the hun got kicked back by the french & Yanks came over on 50 mile front, french took 5000 prisoners. deferred Pay £54-17-6 - 60/8. no word of leave yet or about my discharge. Boys came out alright. Wrote to Nell Posted letter to Maude yesterday. Showers all day Beautiful clear night moon just past the ½.
Entry.50:
Boys went in again last night I wonder what they would do if the Aussies were not here 6 months in & 15 days out , " but no name for it". 

cloudy morning more rain mosquitos very bad & flies by the billion big black brutes. Siddins off to London today my turn soon . deferred Pay£54-19-0 - 62/8. French have advanced 10 kilos taken 11,000 Prisoners estimated at 20,000 taken 100 guns estimated 200. Hooray. Bravo France. Wrote to Viv. Posted letters to Viv & Nell. Shelled out of here about 2 oclock Pm. Put them all round us. very nasty for awhile. French have taken 27,000 Prisoners 200 guns.

 2nd Anniversary of Frommelles
Entry.51:
20/17/18

lovely morning up at 5 getting Packs & Valises got to bed last night about 12-30. Jerry over this morning Piece of shrapnell came through hole in Roof & fell at my feet. Expect we shall get it again from his H.V. gun to day. deferred Pay £55-0-6 - 64/8. Heavy Bombardment again last night near Villers Bretonneux. latest 27,000 Prisoners 360 guns. Tommies & Scotties going over at Albert tomorrow morning. Raining on & off all day.
Entry.52: This time 2 years ago was lying under a tree between some graves, so exhausted & done up slept for 2 days & nights & had a broken finger which I did not get attended to till the afternoon too tired, not likely to forget Frommelles. Heavy rain about 3 a.m. No word about the hop over by Tommies hear that we have a big one tomorrow taking all the Ridge hope it is successful. Deferred Pay £55-2-0 - 66/8. This place reeking with damp no wonder I get Rheum’s/ Nearly got a Blighty yesterday morning Piece of schrap came through Roof & fell at my feet. Fritzs ironmongery went over us twice to day in two directions, Turning cool.
Entry.53:
Beautiful morning very hot, had to have 2 Blankets & great coat over me last night. Jerry was over dropping Bombs last night huge one at that but not here. Our Planes are doing this night & day. Another Cpl went to the American army yesterday. & in not a half Bat./ strong

Another came in to go to school beats cockfighting.

full moon last night & as clear as day deferred Pay £55-3-6 - 68/8. Pay day yesterday got two greats out for Prisoners
Entry.54: following violent headaches for 3 days was taken bad with dysentry yesterday afternoon & put in a very bad time haven’t felt so crook since March 24/16 when I was inoculated in the chest at Tel-el-Kehr. Had fearful Pains in the stomach & was up during the night, feel washed out this morning though better Adjutant wanted me to go to 14th field ambulance yesterday but thought it would pass off, Head still aching. Raining hard & set in for the day. Thousands of Yanks gone up this morning in Battle order must be a stunt on. Heavy gun fire at 12 last night near Villers Bretonneux. deferred Pay ҋ55-5-0 - 70/8. Am right off my tucker. Wrote to Syd yesterday great news this morning we advanced up north & took 12,000 Prisoners & 100 guns Ypres sector. Big stunt down here tonight British helping Italians down South too 400 Prisoners etc Yanks have taken chateau Thierray. Still Raining. Letters from Jack & Tony & Mrs Parsons.
Entry.55: fine morning with clouds, nice & fresh feeling better but tummy still very sore, am able to eat a little. Boys did not go over last night. Nothing of importance. Deferred Pay £55-6-6-72/8 no news of leave yet. Jerry got some more shells over us to day & not too far at that. More rain. Condran gone on escort to Etaples.
Entry.56: fine clear morning but heavy clouds coming up. Fritz sending over terrific Barrage down near Albert Yanks reported to be going over never saw anything like it before, looks like a smoke Barrage. Fritz getting it in the neck all along the line. deferred Pay £55-8-0 - 74/8. Our Boys came out of the line last night to reserves.
Entry.57:
fine like yesterday. good news still coming in from the French, Yanks & British get Fritz this time I think. Czar Dead also his son & reported Hindenberg dead also. deferred Pay £55-9-6 - 76/8

moving out for 10 days spell tomorrow. Wrote to Tony Jack & Carol Posted them Leaver & Lawler going Divi clink in the morning 2 guards as escort C. Chalker going to Pont Remy for Griffiths in the morning Condran away to Etaples for .
Entry.58:
Heavy thunderstorm last night just on going to bed 9.30 heavy rain Again this morning at 4.30 rained in torrents. Boys must be having rotten time in the trenches Coming out Tomorrow night. Ammunition columns a mile long went through last night something doing soon. deferred Pay £55-11-0 - 78/8. Plenty of work in front of me shifting this lot of stuff. Lt. Wood came back today Pretty queer went out again in evening, been drinking. Rained in torrents all day Trenches flooded. Boys coming out to reserves tonight

C Chalker gone for Griffiths to Pont Remy

Sunday 28/7/18

Weather cleared up last night about 8 clear night fritz over bombing all night got pretty close to here once or twice, clouding up again more rain 11 a.m. Charlie arrived with Griffiths Lt Wood came home some time during the night clothes covered in mud. Boys came out alright & are in reserves. Had hair cut & did some washing, shirt underpants & sox. deferred Pay £55-12-6 - 80/8. Condran back from Etaples with Wade. Collie back with Canon. Griffiths Wade & Canon gone up to B.O R. Escort Jewell, Blake & Mellor

no rain today wonderful. Griffiths sent back for F.C. G.M. also Wade

Monday 29/7/18

fine morning. Boys went over last night about 12. 53rd & 8th Brigd. got all objectives. was up watching Bombardment. Rumoured the Crown Princes army smashed up or captured 150 to 250,000 prisoners. deferred Pay £55-14-0 – 82/8.

Dade & Griffiths gone to 5th divi Compound for safe keeping. Wrote to Mrs Parsons Posted it. Sent another escort for Lawler. all the guards away. Getting very hot more rain Boys took about 500 prisoners Last night 8th 350 &
Entry.60: up at 6 BK 6.30 great bustle motor-lorry for Packs at 9.30 am going with them. Arrived here Fremont about 1. came through Amiens this city is almost entirely deserted its awful to think of such a fine place left to itself only soldiers seen now & then Smashed houses everywhere but Grand Old Cathedral still stands though hit 7 times. from the distance you would not think it was touched. came past place where a bomb was dropped by fritz into a Tommie’s dug out alongside the road Poor chap all that was left of him was a few shreds of his tunic & one Puttie in the branches of a tree. Very hot day. Boys wont be here till about 3 or 4 tomorrow morning Fritz counter attacked last night but did no good as per usual. deferred Pay £55-15-6 - 84/8. Right away from the guns first time since Jan 29th/18. close here is Vaux-en-Aminois. &
Entry.61: feel anyhow Vin Blanc Vin Rouge, Biere et cigarettes no bon pour Soldats. Parade this morning for new clothing getting Tunic & Breeches. Should get my leave next week. Pay day today. deferred £55-17-0 – 86/8 drawing 51/4 leave Bal 35/4. fearfully hot. dont know how long we are out for.
Entry.62:
Not paid yet expect it today some time feel pretty right again. Got another man on Police yesterday Chaffer A coy deferred Pay £55-18-6 – 88/8 fearfully hot change soon I think. Am to get new Tunic & Breeches & about time too am in rags. Got some bull dog stout in Canteen & regular Godsend after the muck they sell here. Am still queer in the Tummy.

Raining hard, thought it would, Jerry dropping bombs last night & shelling Amiens with hughe shells shook the ground from here about 7 miles away. Pay today I think deferred Pay £56--- 90/8. off again at 7.45 tonight closer to the line wonder whats up this time. A Com gone on Blighty leave going almost 8 kilos still here 9. P.m.
Entry.63: deferred Pay £56-1-6 – 92/8 Paid 57/4 70 francs Bal/ 41/4. Got here last night at 11.30 Longpre´ morning under sealed orders think there is a big war on tomorrow. Anniversary day of the war. Been raining hard all the time, terribly muddy march sun trying to shine now 12.30 midday. Feeling well today but felt a lot tired. Drunks ye Gods they were all drunk & a nice job I had getting out 2out of 3 sold out at dinner time. To bed about 12 midnight
Entry.64: fine & hot morning off again tonight up to the front area Boys looking very blue. Pat as bad as any, put him away with Chalker on escort. deferred Pay £56-3-0 – 43/4. Artillery going through all night miles of it big push going to take place tonight Yanks & French dong fine work down South taken Sirosons & advanced 2 miles on the whole front. off at 8.15 for another 12 to 20 kilo march 24 young men in Band sent out to Neurleus. but old men like myself sent up to the front Great Army ours & great Heads. I’ll? just be about fit to sleep all day tomorrow no rest for a week. doing night & day duty ever since we came here. £56-4-6 45/4
Entry.65: an awful march of 10 miles in the dark & mud, came through Amiens got here "Busay" into swamps at 1a m. got across somehow by 2 & got to bed done up 1 Blanket & water P. sheet ground all wet, called out 2.30 to place gas guard moving again tonight farther up. Raining hard all afternoon, go up at 9.30. £56-6-0. 47/4
Entry.66: Still here, movement cancelled, Rained in torrents called up at 12 to take in rations for Comp. H Qts. Couldnt see my hand let alone Rations. Worst time I have put in yet as Q.Master. Up at 5.30 a.m to give out Rations. My run as Gas guard, Rained during the day again fine now. £56-7-6 49/4
Entry.67: fine morning, hun Planes dropped Bombs by the doz. all round here but none close. thank goodness. off tonight for the "what I wonder" Very hot, just got an extra 50 Rounds of Ammo & 2 Bombs. So. this time tomorrow some more history made £56-4-0 – 51/4.
Entry.68: up all night fell in at ¼ to 2 a.m. & marched about 4 kilos then sat down in field on the wet mud & grass for nearly an hour, then the Barrage started & hell was let loose, After it had been going about 10 minutes we went on again & marched right through the guns to here Old H. Qts. Our boys went over 8,000 Prisoners taken, guns stopped , but Tanks & planes still kept at it. Huge shell just landed 25 yds away gee whiz must have come 25 miles never heard it coming. Its been a great day for the Aussies they have pushed the hun back to old lines of 1916 & taken thousands of prisoners. Never saw so many tanks & planes at one time must have been hundreds. tired out 8.30 p.m. Guns Roaring, shells bursting, Bombs dropping etc etc must have marched 15 miles carrying 170 rounds of ammo 2 Bombs, Rifle, 2 Water Bottles, 48 hours Rations, Hammock, Water Proof & 1 Blanket. £56-10-6 -53/4. heavy mist this morning like fog.
Entry.69:
Everything going grand 8000 Prisoners 103 guns. Yesterday other things could not be counted but saw terrible lot of loot myself. fine morning tho cloudy. The Artillery is Pounding away & the boys still advancing. Had to dig in last night may be here all day & on early tomorrow. Its grand to be an Aussie this day. God bless the Boys. 2Pm. still going strong, Put up record for the war in one day Push, 55th go over tomorrow morning. 2 trains captured one full of Hospital supplies & nurses & one full of huns nearly got a third, Rumoured, 40,000 Prisoners & 300 guns in all the front. £56-12-0 – 55/4

Saturday 10/8/18

great Battle started on our lift last night & was a great sight they took their objective & got Prisoners & guns but dont know how many Tommies & Yanks, this morning our Boys are going

it again on the right and are at it hammer & tongs guns firing everywhere, still keeping fine 9a.m. one of our own Planes shot one of our Baloons down thinking it was a fritz shows how quickly we advanced going up today. 12 noon just got orders to Pack up & leave for Back arear again dam funny. Here we are again alongside Villers Brettonneux where we started from. long march 5 P.m. very tired 5th Div coming out
Entry.70: Div/ still advancing 800 Prisoners came through. fritz shelling Villers Bret/ & all roads from 20 miles back an advance has been made in the north of 8 Kilos, got Jerry this time I think. expect he will be round bombing tonight am sleeping out in the open under bush. Letter from Maude. £56-13-6 – 57/4
Entry.71: fine hot morning, did not sleep all night, fritz’s Planes bombing alright dropped hundreds on Roads & billets etc 2 H.V. guns firing all night just close to here. Boys hopped it again this morning at 4am & advanced, can hardly hear guns from here. Been down for swim in Somne canal. grand feel fresh & clean again off tomorrow to the front again, over the top this time. French advanced again things going good. oh. £56-15-0 – 59/4
Entry.72: fine & fearfully hot again, fritz over us again last night dropping Bombs & firing his M.Gs/. his H.V. guns are out of Range as he only fired 3 shots all night Off tonight & over in the morning, all our guns gone forward fearful work getting the 9.2s up. Wrote to Nell & Maude One smashed Village we Passed on the 8th was La Motte. £56-16-6 – 61/4
Entry.73: fine & hot again off this morning about 12 miles, Hun planes over again last night but no damage here. Heavy Bombing. last night & this morning off at 11-30. Got here Caix 5Pm. came through Caye. Both towns more than villages fritz shells Caix with naval guns. Plane came down on fire just as we got here so expect plenty of Bombs tonight. Last camp slept in shell hole This place am in a thicket great protection Order cancelled about 2-am. not going till tomorrow thank heaven £56-18-0 – 63/4
Entry.74:
glorious weather again Plenty of Bombs last night but none here a few H.V. shell duds fell close not much sleep going up tonight 

 

& over in the morning, Passed a lot of captured guns latest 26,000 prisoners 450 guns got dump with 1,000,000 gas shells, also full Railways & Rolling stock. going up cancelled again Very hot day. £56-14-6 – 65/4.
Entry.75: fine & going to be another scorcher. Bombardment at 4 a m Push as far as Arras. Canadians advanced 7 Kilos Jerry Bombs & shelled us last night galore. Packing up again off tonight back again, what’s up are we only spare parts or what. Came up here to last Posi that Canadians failed on twice & they wouldn’t stand it so off again at 9.Pm. £57-1-0 – 67/4
Entry.76: got here "Freyart" into trenches at 1-am. after 5 hrs marching near where we left again, told it was 5 miles nearer so under shell fire & bombs all the way, left Canadians to relieve Tommies who have been in 6 days. Great scrap going on on our left. Hot & fine again, moving again tonight 57-1-6 – 69/4
Entry.77: moved into trenches again better than last further away from Batteries Boys did silent Raid this morning at 2 a.m. got 7 prisoners & 3 mguns 3 of ours killed & 7 wounded, Capt Wilson one of them. Cloudy & cool. Canadians advanced another 10 kilos. Mail in no letters for me. no smells here thank goodness. 57-4-0 – 71/4
Entry.78: slight rain last night & heavy Bombt/. on left & right. fritz shelled us here. pretty sultry while it lasted 1 dud came through Parapet close to me, no news yet what it all meant. Papers from Maude. Another 3 or 4 days to go yet. Brought in 2 salvaged Planes. My men guarding them. Places we have been marching to & from. Huilly, Brommery, Burry, Amiens, Vaup, Farillny, Villes Bretonneux. La Mette, Fouyart, Cayen, Caux cold wind tonight. 57-5-6 – 73/4.
Entry.79: fine but cloudy, much cooler. seem to be at a standstill here. Good our posi.. heavy clouds 6. P.m. 57-7-0 – 75/4
Entry.80:
had busy night last night & close shave jerry shelled us & one 8" fell about 15 yds away, half my dug-out fell in & my candle was blown the side of w n d. there was a great stampede for a time, he also sent smaller shells "gas" but no harm done. This morning he set fire to huge timber dump captured from him them £1-000,000 worth of timber there & we can do nothing as he keeps shellimg it, Hear me moving out tomorrow hope so as my leave is about due

warmer but very much like rain again Jim goes on leave today lucky bugger cleaning up, clear & full moon Jerry will be over even more. 57-8-6 – 77/4
Entry.81:
nothing much happened some gas gerry sent over had masks on for 30 mint/. was up at 2 a m. heavy fog, very hot this morning & then huns shelling with 8" all over the place put a couple in our trench pieces flying all over the place, he is shelling the dump some & support lines The fire was got under during the night & is only smoking no great damage done. Shelled us all day expect more tonight. 57-10-0 – 79/4

Thursday 22/8/18

had a bad night of it tried to get a lie down 4 times but shelled out each time & gassed also Bombed at daylight. Just getting to sleep when Bombt/ started on our left 3rd Div went over, no news yet 3 more of ours killed & 4 wounded yesterday 1st Div hops over from our lines tomorrow morning Jerry very nervous shells us with 8" every ½ hour or so. Got diarrhoea since yesterday. Orders to Pack up moving out I think so for 8 killed & 8 wounded. 57-11-6 – 81/4
Entry.82: up all night, very sleepy, went to sleep in middle of Barrage which was terrific, guns just behind us & alongside of us & so, started 4-45. but all silent now7.a.m. Prisoners coming in by the 100s & a lot of huns killed. Have had enough of this gas last night & this morning. 5Pm. Boys still fighting m.guns rattling, But they advanced a lot. Hun plane flying low came over us just now nearly got me with tracer bullet, hit the bank 2 feet away, Charlie gone out gassed got 2 men left. 7Pm. still advancing 3rd Div captured Arm Corps Commander & staff yesterday -1st Div got a 11" & Battery of 5.9s also smaller guns. Great Battle going on on the right, Canadians. Big storm coming up off to Bed 9.30. wonder for how long got my Boots off anyway first time for 3 days & nights French had great Victory got 400 guns 2 hun divisions cleared out wouldn’t fight that’s the stuff to gie you. 57-13-0 – 83/4
Entry.83: cloudy & little heavy rain coming in, last night at 12 hun planes came over & nearly got the lot of us dropped almost 1 doz Bombs along the Parapet of the trench, not one fell in, but two got hit on the top a very close thing, Don’t think I ever tried to make myself so small & envied the worm. Still Packed up ready to move, at 1 a m terrible Bombt/ was put up by our artillery 3rd Div must have gone over again Guns seem farther away this morning Quiet all day 57-14-6 85/4
Entry.84: Mother would have been 73 today God bless her. 1st Div took 3000 prisoners 14. 77s 2 Tank guns & 1. 15" etc etc Planes are very thick last night but did not drop any here Very hot again this morning but cool night with fog this morning Hun came back this morning. Fritz still shelling with 7" stuff dont seem to have any other kind Posted letter to Nell yesterday Going bed 9-30 storm & heavy rain no Jerry’s tonight. 57-16-0 - 87/4
Entry.85:
Very heavy storm last night rain comes into dug-outs & made it a bit miserable, much cooler to day. Guns shifting up, new push on, very quiet Artillery report the hun evacuated, means another week or two for us moving forward tonight. Boys go over in the morning, still showery strong wind blowing, drying up fast, order cancelled, going out instead, now not going out but staying here. Nothing like good organisation, what. Quietest day for months. Jerry not to be found. Got clean change today & needed it 57-17-6 – 89/4

Tuesday 27/8/18

actually no new orders. corkers came up last night like more rain, much cooler now hot weather done. 1st div advanced another 3 Kilos & got 400 huns. A big hop over in store for us all Wrote to Nell, & Syd Posted. Have gone back to Coy. Raining 57-19-0 - 91/4

Wednesday 29/8/19

Miserable morning, fine rain & strong wind, Summer gone. Big Push busted up etc. Been ready for hop over for 3 weeks but too much delay, now have to go over in the mud, can’t hear a gun from here. 13 months since my last leave. The hun has evacuated & the Baloons are gone forward fully 2 miles our 12" guns are shooting 10,000 yds behind our lines 15th Brigade just gone through to support 8th raining hard. 58-0-6-93/4
Entry.86:
off this morning after fritz, been fine & clear all night but cloudy now 9.a.m. Jerry’s Planes fired at us last night with m.guns great scatter etc. Is my leave ever coming. Have been crook for 3 or 4 days now, gassed again slightly. coughing all day & night & throat like a rasp. Got to Wood 3 Kilos & started to settle down Got bosker Posi with bunks in it for 4 cleaned it out Gathered Bag of leaves for Pillow when fall in rang out & off we went again. Have just got here 3 Pm & have crossed what was jerrys front line this morning Going on again 

tonight the
Entry.88: Brigades have crossed the river already and we will have a nice dark march of about 10 kilos & going another 10. off at 6 Pm. got here at 9. not far from the Guns. told to wait till it gets dark. 58-2-0 – 95/4.
Entry.89: After waiting for 2 hours were told to make ourselves comfortable staying the night. There is a bit of sunken Rd off main Rd about 2 am it started raining & it was not joyful. Stopped about 3 but very cold fritz’s guns going all night. Brks. 4-30 Rice & tea & it warmed us up a bit. Great battle started on our left about 5 & still going strong. Our Planes are swarming over his lines & we move forw’d in about 20 minutes. Got here old French trenches about 7-30 & still here 5P.m. dont know whether we move or not tonight looks like more rain. on the way up yesterday passed dead huns Horses, mules etc stench awful. This part of the country from Amiens to Peronne is very desolate where Villages were now is nothing but rubble the woods have been blasted & are all dead only the off shoots showing any green & the fighting must have been terrific, Passed shell holes you could Put a 4 roomed house in & as close together that only a fringe of earth separates them. All this was done by fritz when he was after Paris first time. the French soldiers must have had a murderous time of it 58-3-6 – 97/4.
Entry.90: off again at 10-30 through Peronne etc 2nd Div took Mt St Quenton last night. Spelled for dinner 2-30 stew only. was shelled all the way & expect to be on to the finish being under observation all the time. So far he has got pretty close to us but no casualties yet. Must be near Peronne now a lot of water in front of us dont know if its River Somme or Canal or Marshes. My heel is skinned also one toe & feel very tired & stiff have marched now for 3 weeks at this game. Think the Boys hop it in the morning. Raining letter from Syd Papers from Maude a regular God send. Off again across the Somme Marshes. under shell fire all the time Got here on side of chalk hill swarms with Aussies, Jerrys Baloon was up all the time & he is shelling this place like hell with 5.9"s & 8" have to stay here all night, cant see how we can miss getting hit. 58-5-0. 99/4
Entry.91: what an awful night God only knows how it is any of us are alive the shells were bursting only 10 & 15 yds away at times & no one was hit, the splinters all went forward. At 6 a.m. we moved forward still under fire to about 400 yds with dug-outs. no sooner got here than Young Riley was blown in half, Cec Gill, Bert Cobb wounded, Bert Mitchell killed, Wally Rodgers Badly wounded. Stretcher carriers coming in fast now & so are hun Prisoners galore, carrying our wounded. Raining heavily this morning but sun shining again. I wonder how much more of this I can stand. Will have done 3 years in 5 days time. Just written above when shell landed ~ few yds in front of us killing 4 horses & wounding 2 drivers one had his foot blown off. Our Boys still advancing & have taken Peronne casualties very great, no support much from Artillery. Much quieter than this time yesterday. May stay here all night. Letter from Nell with £1. enclosed "good old Girl". 58-6-6 – 101/4
Entry.92:
dull, cold morning, warned at 5 to get ready to move at any moment. still here 9 a.m. Boys getting a bad time D coy got 30 men left. out of these 5 men wounded A Coy 8 killed 12 wounded Poor old Siddons gone also Lt Collins. Lt Horron wnd. /

Prisoners still coming in 3700 up to this morning Caught huns massing for counter attack, guns got into him & the place is simply a shambles, guns got direct hit. how much longer are they going to stand this awful loss & how much longer are they going to keep us in. No one will be left soon. The Prussians & . Volunteered to stop the Aussies here, must be sorry for themselves now. This place was "Clery" but only a few bricks are left of it now. Boys coming out tonight. 58-8-0 – 103/4
Entry.93:
up nearly all night & out at 5 this morning Put in a lovely time thank heaven we are out of that hell at last. 180 strong. Cpt Cotterill & Ted Edwards had a shell to themselves Blown to bits. Cpt King badly wounded in face taken to dressing station when another shell blew his leg off. 56th about 80 strong. 53rd nearly wiped out. We are now in a deep ravine about 2 Kilos from former Posi? & were greeted here with 3 big shells with gas in them got some down my throat again, it will finish me yet. Lovely day, fine & clearing up. Winter coming on fast. My Heel very Painful & all festered & tomorrow we move off again. Had 3 rum issues while on this stunt first for 6 months. Got Pr of Sox from Grace Bros & sure needed them now. Wrote to Nell

My men on gas guard. 58-9-6 – 105/4
Entry.94: Jerry sent gas over last night but not much of it came our way. Hot fine morning. Brigadier Hobbs just reviewed the remnant of us, tells us wi/ the 14th Brigade did the impossible in taking Peronne High French Generals said it would take a month & fearful sacrifice of life to take it. We took it in a few hours. It is considered the finest feat in the war & beats Gallipoli. Total Ns of Prisoners 130,000 – 200 guns 15,000 m.guns 13,000 Trench mortars etc etc to end of August. The Brig/d. said words failed him & nothing he could say would be half good enough, he was filled with admiration for the 55th & better soldiers never breathed. Never had such praise as this before but suppose it means going in again shortly. He said the Bosche army is thoroughly disorganised. From the heights here can see right down into Peronne & a lot of it seems to be untouched. The view is splendid. 58-11-0 – 107/4
Entry.95: slight rain during the night but fine this morning & cool nothing during the last night Jerry must have evacuated again, a lot of his dumps are on fire. Baths today, got clean shirt yesterday also fruit & Biscuits & cigs. 3.30 Pm just got orders to Pack up & move in again at 2 minutes notice a Bat/ of 180 to go into the line. murder is no name for it Dr/ saw my heel this morning & says it is not so serious. "come on you dammed slacker. I have to go in again instead of resting. Leaving at 7 Pm. 58-12-6 – 109/4.
Entry.96: 3 years to day since I went into Got here last night about 11. supposed to come 500 yds. came 10. off again this morning another 5kilos. was soaking wet so cold as ice all night. guns banging away & fires everywhere. Came through Eterpigny. once large Town now rubbish. 16 hun Planes came over us Bombing & m.gunning so as we were marching up threw ourselves down on the grass & expected the worst but not one man hit. Place we stayed at last night was Barlaugh same old thing marched 10 kilos instead of 5 & had to come back 2 camped dug-in on the side of little bank about 2 ft. 6" high 10 Jerry Planes repeated the dose this afternoon same result. 58-14-0 – 110/4
Entry.97:
Put in miserable night, heel very bad, something wrong with my ear had one out at 3.am. couldnt lie down. Off again this morning Up at 5 BK.6. marched about 4 Kilos to ruined village "Bothess". shells going overhead. We are about 5 miles from Peronne good news keeps coming in got flannel rash to keep heel & ear company. War’s gone

further back, can just hear guns. had a shave & wash first for 4 days. 58-15-6 – 111/4.
Entry.98: up at 5 ready to chase Jerry again when order cancelled so still staying here. Sun just rising 6am. Jerry was dropping bombs early this morning & shelling just beyond us during the night. Lovely morning & hardly the sound of a gun. Letter from Maud yesterday & Paper from Nell. Posted letter to Nell. been raining heavily clear now 6.30Pm. 58-17-0 – 113/4
Entry.99: Warned for Blighty leave this morning up at 5 reported B.O.R 6.30 been walking ever since now 1 Pm. can’t find H,Qrs. great Bat/ this. Done up & waiting for Bat/ to come out this is Le Misnet. Boys came out 4 Pm. going H.Qrs by Limber then off toCorbie. 58-18-6. 115/4
Entry.100: Just caught Sgt Jenkins with my Pass as I got here, he was off to Jim’s Bat/ walked fully 20 miles. He wants me to stay here till tomorrow but am off caught G.S waggon went almost 6 miles then walked 2 miles & caught motor lorry got to Villers Bretonneux & caught another got to Amiens at 12 midnight up at 7 no time to shave, am in train for Boulogne 9.a.m, slept on floor of empty house last night with only Water Proof sheet on me Rained all the way out & raining now. 59-0-0 – 117/4
Entry.101: Am in Blighty 6-30 Pm. Rough Passage just finished up 7-30 staying at YMCA tonight Belgrade Rd off to Scotland in two days 59-1-6 – 119/4
Entry.102: Very tired & weary not fit to go anywhere going to Bank for money & will get fitted up generally theatre tonight Perhaps. 59-3-0 – 121/4
Entry.103:
Rotten head this morning stout too heavy going Scotland tonight had enough of London too vast etc 59-4-6 – 123/4

Saw Dr/ at HQs Have to report on 23rd re my Eyes & Ear.
Entry.104:
Arrived Glasgow 6-30 Train to Prestwick 8.20 got here about 10 went to Ayr with Maude this afternoon Pictures & Pastries etc 

59-6-0
Entry.105: Raining hard & cold stuck in all day. Went for walk with Alex in the afternoon to see Burns’ Well. etc. 59-7-6
Entry.106: Rained all night & still doing so, gale blowing, wrote to just going to Post it great place for a rest can’t do anything else 59-9-0
Entry.107: Up in Ayr today to see Burns’ Cottage & monument etc etc very interesting put in all the afternoon doing the sights. Going Glasgow tomorrow. 59-10-6
Entry.108: Been to Glasgow fine City. 2 Picture shows & 1 theatre got home again 11-30 dead tired & so was Maude, went up by 9.am train Maude very thin & getting very grey. 59-12-0
Entry.109: feel much better today my ear not troubling me so much hope it is going to get O.K. going to Ayr again this afternoon. Off to London tomorrow via Leeds etc was through Paisley, Toon, Irvin etc yesterday sending Booklet to Nell. 59-13-6
Entry.110: off at 9-5 get London 8-30 P.m stayed at Salvation Army Rooms Belgrave Rd. 59-15-0
Entry.111: up at 9. Now to see things. Been to Tower of London. Met a good chap. Uncle to one of our C.S. Majors. Charlie Tubin taking me round London fine introduced me to chums club Am going to stay with him at Cury House. 59-16-6. Theatre
Entry.112: saw monument erected on sight where great fire of 1666 started also saw the only house left standing also the cheshire cheese, went through Petticoat lane amongst the Yids. In the afternoon Hyde Park for the Band then on to the Albert Hall & Albert statue & memorial A Beautiful Work one of the finest in London at night down to South Kensington, Walked back very tired great day. Have to see Dr/ tomorrow. 59-18-0
Entry.113: reported to Dr/ at H.Qrs sent me to specialists at Queen Alexandria’s Hospital told to report tomorrow 2 ½ hours gone. Went to club Picture show & Theatre Wren 54-19-6
Entry.114: only one day left off tomorrow am now at Hospital waiting got great examination of the eyes & bar nothing serious get night Blindness got recipe for glasses 60-1-0
Entry.115: got an extra day on account of so much messing about by Drs & time lost, off tomorrow dont know what to do with myself tonight must be up at 5 to catch 6 Train. 60-2-6
Entry.116: Am at Folkestone for the day glad to get out of London too strenuous. (Goodman. Optician. Totenham Court Rd London.) Bang went £25 but it was worth it 60-4-0\
Entry.117: Got to Boulogne 4 P.m. fine trip different to other, fine day but a little rain over here. Marched up to BlanketHill, Camp almost deserted saw the Aussies lead everywhere now off Train on to Boat & off Boat into camp etc. to bed early. 60-5-6 P-Cards to Syd, Nell & Boys
Entry.118: off at 7-30 for the Bat/ wherever it is got here Neucleus Camp almost 4 Pm stuck here indefinately. Rained in torrents all the way. am in tent with 11 others. Major Caine in charge of lot, very cold & only one blanket & that damp. This place La Chapellotte 1Kilo from Peronne. Boys supposed to have gone over this morning 60-7-0
Entry.119: Great Afternoon Sir Joseph Cook & Sir Conan Doyle addressed us & we had 18 Bands massed & the music was great, thin rain all the time but would not have missed it for anything. Great Battle going on on 90 mile front can expect good news in 48 hours time so Commandant says. 60-8-6. went to church Parade this morning.
Entry.120: beastly night, Rain & gale, our tent blown down. About settled down again & feel I haven’t been away at all - drill this morning first for a long long time. fearfully cold & Raining. Our first still going strong, but not much news coming in. Bulgaria given in unconditionally Italy taken 25,000 Prisoners & 50,000 more Turks taken, must soon end now Very cold in tent tonight got small Brazier going. 60-10-0
Entry.121: A lovely morning, cold Breeze blowing, but sun shining. great Bombt all night very intense early this morning. Aussies & Yanks got objectives some more good fellows gone Mick Canknall C.S.M., Mark Ball. Capt Goldrick, , Sgt/ Sarholm continuously waiting further news. Believe we got out for long spell after this month. Went to Le Mensoil for Pack, could not get it. 60-11-6
Entry.122:
another fine morning. first frost of the year, Sun hot, let off Parade too old for drilling. Am in Peronne now having a look at the damage done not one house escaped all smashed. Our Prisoners Cage is here & there are 1000s of huns in them. Boys niggers & chums Bargaining with them for watches rings etc. More coming in. Our Bat/. 110 Baynotts strong. Lt/ Wilbour killed. One of our Airmen got into difficulties last night & had to come down first dropping his bombs, dropped one just south of Tent where one of the 3rd Div Band was killed 4 & wounded 8. 

60-13-0. talk about our going forward.
Entry.123: My birthday 46 today & feeling well. Grand morning, heavy Bombt/ again early this morning, News splendid on all fronts, The French are in St/ Quentin, Yanks came out yesterday had a bad time. Was in Peronne again today trying to get cigs but could not buy them. Got back at 12 found them all packed up to go up to the front. Took a Prisoner with me & went part of the way in trucks on light railway nearly had bad accident the last two trucks jumped the rails & I was in the 3rd one the end one toppled over & ours was doing likewise when Engine stopped. Got off at Raisel, marched through Helvilly, Flambeaup. then getting here at 9.Pm about 4 kilos from Hindenberg line had to wait about till 12 for limber bringing Packs. Slept under limber too cold & tired to get any sleep. Jerry Banging away all night. Came 25 kilos altogether 60-19-6 Poor Ham Bush was killed on the 1st & Jack Aitkins wounded.
Entry.124: & that’s how I put in my 46 Birthday. am in a smashed up Village with no name to it. Rumour that Turkey has thrown in the sponge. Austria next I suppose. Then the gentle hun gets his turn Oh Yes. 60-16-0
Entry.125:
off Pack’d out this morning 20 kilo march then train to – this place close to Belincourt or Estress. Got here Le Meeriel at about 4.30 dead beat. In huts here & log fire going. Yankee Band quartered here also.

60-17-6. sprained my foot before leaving.
Entry.126: Yankee Band giving us a concert tonight. also gave us one last night but too tired to enjoy it . Windy & cloudy today All the Boys in great spirits at getting out for 3 months spell. Hope we have finished war. Just had a Good Bye Parade to Col Woods? who is off to Aussie. 60-14 0
Entry.127:
still here, fine chaps those who is off to Aussie. 60-14 0

Monday 7/10/18

still here, fine chaps those Yanks, leaving here at 10 for Peronne & train. left at 11-30 & Peronne at 4. 61-0-6
Entry.128: Alnais Camp the last place we were in. Got out of Train at 8 am & marched 10 kilos in the dark & rain with full Pack etc. got here Vismus-du-Vol. quiet little village. Lot of the Boys off to explore other Villages near by. Turning fine 61-2-0
Entry.129: fine morning but nippy. slept like top all night Boys all dead beat, pub open from 10-30 to 1-30. 6 to 9. Wrote to Amos & sent him letters. Also wrote to Nell & trustee Ray Syd, Viv & Mrs Parsons & Arthur. 61-3-6.
Entry.130: Nothing doing. still waiting no parades. a lot of sun today stuck up in one of the estaminets by one of the Goal Birds just returned from 12 months Morgan. 61-5-0
Entry.131:
Nice & mild but rain hanging about Paid 40 francs 61-6-6

Saturday12/10/18

Raining all day. Parcel from Nell & Yathella S.C.Fund. 61-8-0
Entry.132: Rained all night & doing so now, great news the huns accepted Pres/ Wilson’s terms 61-9-6
Entry.133: Bitterly cold night could not sleep through it. Excitement very great every where over the huns giving in or ready to give in. Anxiously waiting for todays paper. Am drawing 2/6 a day since Cpl 5/18 got credit in Book yesterday of £4-9-6 & 14 days @
Entry.134: = 35/- £6-4-6 now owing me to date. £5-3-2. £61-10-6 wrote to Yathella S C fund & Grace Bros/
Entry.135: Rained all night, still raining have to take 3 chaps for Court Martial about 5 kilos get back some time tonight. £5-5-8 £61-12 Deferred Pay.
Entry.136:
dull & fine rain again got to take Prisoner to Court Martial again Another day with no dinner I suppose. £5-8-2-

 61-3-6
Entry.137: Still raining might have to take prisoners again to day. splendid news coming in Lille almost taken £5-10-8. £61-15-0. deferred Pay wrote & Posted letter to Nell last night. Wrote & posted letter to Viv.
Entry.138: Wrote & Posted letter to Jack, foggy morning, sun just coming out 10 am very cold. 5.13.4.$61.16.6 nothing much to write about Posted letters to Yathella Comfort fund wrote to Mrs Parsons & Posted it.
Entry.139: heavy fog but turned out lovely morning sun shining got some clothes dry cloudy in afternoon. C Bs Orders. Wrote & Posted Xmas letters to Al & Syd. 5-15.10 $61.18 – Lille, Bruges, Ostend, Bauvai, Relaix & fallen
Entry.140: news still keep good. Rained all night & still doing so 9.a.m. Bill taking Prisoner to Fluercourt. 5-18.4 £61-19-6.
Entry.141: fine rain still. H Qts/ Parade at 10. good news still coming in 6-0-10 £32-1-8 feeling pretty crook. Bad cold high temperature Flu I suppose a lot down with it Dyptheria in the Village also
Entry.142: Went to Bed at 5 P.m. put in a Bad night Pains all over me Bladder Kidneys legs & arms feel a bit beter but head aching a lot. 6-3-4. £62-2-6
Entry.144: Been Pretty bad with the dog disease temperature very high on Wednesday were going to send me to hospital but asked them not to am up for first time in 4 days pretty weak & giddy First time ill since Joining army 3 yearsr & 2 months. Weather keeping mild & fine Bill gone to Boulogne for Prisoners. Jim down to it Flu. £6-10-10 £62-7-0 Getting paid on
Entry.145: Looks like rain coming. News still good from the front.+ Wrote to Maude Posted it.
Entry.146:
Raining, am up today but still dizzy can hardly see to write 11-30 am. Eyes getting very bad.

£6-13-4 - £62-8-6.
Entry.147: Just got up 12-30 put in rotten night, cold, head still crook but almost right again, had to go to bed again yesterday light headed try it again today. £6-15-10-£62-10-0. Wrote & Posted letter to Nell, feeling better tonight should be able to resume duty Tomorrow
Entry.148:
glorious morning, sun quite hot, feel better, going on duty, Pay day tomorrow £6-18-4. £62-11-6.

Genal/ Hobbs here to day.
Entry.149: mild night & lovely morning again more like summer than winter. Pay to day. £7-0-10- £62-13-0 C Dr orders. getting cloudy & like rain Paid 100 Francs 3-16-8 Balance £3-4-0
Entry.150: Cold clear night & nippy morning but fine Austria thrown it in Turkey next I suppose then the hun. £3-6-6 £62-14-6. demobilization Scheme read out this morning for Australia when we get back to day is the big conference in Berlin re Bill’s abdication
Entry.151: fine weather gone, raining but mild, Big Parade this morning am exempt. £3-9-0 £62-16-0 Portiels off to Aussie aware he is. Malingered since 1916.
Entry.152:
Heavy fog, like more rain no letters yesterday £3-11-6 – 62-17-6 

Pretty swift last night Estammiel & Bottle Lady du Val. Turkey surrendered yesterday Bat/. Parade on this morning Tomorrow Divisional Parade. what’s it all in aid of.
Entry.153: Warm Night but rain coming to day Parade on 9-30 Austria slung it in last news last night. next week the huns. £3-14-0 £62-19-0 got dinkum oil this morning going into the line again in 2 weeks time must be too many Australians alive yet or they haven’t got enough Blood Ribbons yet.
Entry.154: little rain this morning, warm night. Church Parade. splendid news still coming in . £3-16-6 £63-0-6 letters from Nell, Syd, Jack, Carol, Arthur & cousin from James. very cold afternoon & night.
Entry.155: lovely morning, not a cloud. Austria signs Peace 3 Pm to day. Nells letter a beauty. what sort of a woman is able at all. 2 Parcels coming from James. £3-19-0. £63-2-0 Wrote to Syd & Nell nice letter in reply to the latter
Entry.156: Raining hard, high wind all day yesterday, Posted letters to Syd Arthur & Mrs H. hope she enjoys it as much as I did hers. £4-1-6. £63-3-6. C Os orders and Court Martial on to day.
Entry.157: Still raining never stopped all night. Wrote to Terry & Jack Min Girdler & Grace Bros/. thanking them for Cigs. £4-4-0 £63-5-0 Wrote to Miss Byrne GBs. & Lucy. Rained all day.
Entry.158: Rained all night heavily was out in it closing up at 8 simply poured down, bought tin of syrup 2 1/2 francs Battery 2.75 francs. £4-6-6 - £63-6-6 Posted all letters, trying to be fine at last. news came through that war is finished French People very excited hear it is an armistice.
Entry.159: Rain stopped yesterday but still heavy clouds about, everyone greatly excited war practically finished wonder when we will get home or if we will see Berlin Rum issue last night got Bott of Point black & put over 4 in it was tres Bang. £4-9-0 £63-8-0
Entry.160:
Heavy frost this morning, lovely day, it was a freezer RSM, Dunne gone to 4th Army School. Huns got till Monday at 11 a.m. to sign Armistice in the meatime they are getting hell knocked out of them 2 stray through here yesterday. £4-11-6 £63-9-6

Parcel of Periodicals & letter from Maude yesterday. got cake issued to us last night, but no rum.
Entry.161: On duty till 11 last night, heavy frost; beautiful day quite warm extraordinary weather for France this time of the year. Very cold in England. Bill the Butcher has abdicated just came through, All the Boys coming back from England Batallion filling up. We were transferred to H.Qrs/ last night. £4-14-0. £63-11-0 washed 2 shirts & underpants, Sox.
Entry.162:
Peace day I suppose, fine, but cloudy no frost, but cold. hear we are going up to the front salvaging £4-16-6 £63-12-6. Wrote & Posted letter to Viv News verified hostilities ceased 11 A.M. today not as much excitement as at a tame football match, Raining 7 P.m. no

money amongst the Boys all miserable Flags flying from a few houses but as tame as a mothers meeting Am sitting in a Barn playing Patients. We can’t realise yet that it is all over Wonder what I am going back to more war I suppose.
Entry.163: fine but cloudy rained all night was out in it till 11 pm last night, F.G.C.M. today. great day in Abbeville Bill & Pat were in there. Brigade sports to day. £4-19-0 £63-14-0
Entry.164: heavy frost, very cold, fine day. excitement all over 36 days armistice, will be here for Xmas. £5-1-6 £63-15-6. letters 2 from wife 2 Jack 2 Viv 2 Syd 1 Arthur 1 Mrs Parsons. wrote to Maude
Entry.165: Posted Maudes letter very cold again, severe frost, fine day. Lilte Willie murdered yesterday or day before. £5-4-0 £63-15-6. Pay day tomorrow wrote & Posted letter to Syd.
Entry.166: Pay day to day won’t there be a hit up not afiff it myself Writing to Viv to day £5-6-6. £63-17-0. Wrote & Posted letter to Viv. Paid 70 francs One of the Police getting a decoration.
Entry.167:
Wrote to Arthur Posted it terrible hard frost very cold tho fine had some champagne this morning.

£63-18-6
Entry.168: Iron frost this morning ground like granite couldn’t sleep for the cold Great Parade on this morning getting dinkumoil about future movements Are going into Germany 10 miles a day for 20 days 100 Rounds of Amunition etc etc fancy I see myself doing it. £64-0-0 Wrote to Mrs Parsons, Jack & Bank London. Posted them.
Entry.169: Wrote my last letter from France to Syd Posted it. Bitterley Cold frost & cloudy snow coming £64-1-6
Entry.170:
Brigade March Past very busy morning G`

enr/ Hobbs here & staff. Not moving now till Saturday. £64-3.0. Much milder to day cloudy night last night. £3-0-10

Wednesday20/11/18

Fog & frost very cold, C Gs Orders off on Friday or Saturday, Medical Exam this morning Passed of course. £64-4-6 £3-3-4
Entry.171: Beautiful morning fog gone heavy frost full kit inspection this morning Prior to going to Germany £64-6-0 £3-5-10 off to Abbeville for half a days leave
Entry.172: fine morning heavy white frost like snow, did not enjoy my trip much packed in motor waggon & coming home a lot of Boys drunk. had new boots to make it more pleasant Court martial to day (Arnott) £64-7-6 £3-8-4. Not going to Germany after all. Hooray no one wants to anyway. good old Billy Hughes
Entry.173: Heavy frost again, off on Monday to Germany, Review by W M Hughes tomorrow, Curse the march into Germany no one wants it except the Officers £64-9-0 £3-10-10
Entry.174: Last day here off tomorrow morning 15kilos to Pont Remy to entrain have about 500 miles in front of us when we leave the train. slight Rain last night, much warmer, snow soon now £64-10=6 £3-13-4.
Entry.175:
Been on the go since writing last, left Vumes Au Val at 9.am. marched to Abbeville 18 kilos, had new boots so I suffered hell was going to fall out but couldnt some-how staggered into Abbeville about 3. turned into a waterlogged Paddock, very cold, made fire & then when dark the band put on a bit of a concert, raining most of the time , left at 9 for Train 44 of us in dark in truck, couldn’t treat pigs worse & of all the Journeys I have done it was the worst had a Brazier but it was curse 

instead of a blessing, we all got black as ink & breathed this coal smoke for 30 hours my head nearly split couldn’t get any sleep no room to lie down if the hun prisoners were treated like that there would be hell to play inhuman treatment etc, but of course we are only Aussies & anything is good enough for them so much for our heads with their 1st class carriages & motors dam them Anyhow it will cure Australians of going to war again for England. Arrived at destination Tresnay at 10 P.m. following night got ½ Pint of cocoa & a couple of Broken bisquits then off on the tramp again through towns & villages untouched by the war raining all the time & the roads all cobbled "oh my feet." got here after a lot of messing about done up another 10 kilos too knocked up to go for blankets so slept on Water Proof sheet with wringing wet coat on top too tired to care much what happened. This morning woke up cold & stiff but it is warm up here compared with where we were a lot of rain about & we are off again tomorrow. £64-15-0 £4-0-10. just had a shave & wash up feel better. some of the towns we camr through Abbeville, Amiens, Peronne , Marquaix, Roiville, Guizecourt, Mascoing, This Place Busigny, The station we came to may have been Bohaine instead of Tresnay. also Cambrai but could not see much of it dark
Entry.176:
left Busigny at 9-30. Had good billet People very good to us coffee galore gave them Bully Tobacco & cigs & socks. Had a hell of a march over newly mettled roads & raining all the time got here Massinghein at ¼ to .1. done up. off again tomorrow still Raining 4P.m. £64-16-6 £4-3-4. What an awful time these Poor People have had. At Busigny is a young girl not 16 yet who is Paralysed for life through the Beasts raping her continually. nearly all the girls & Women have or are having children to the Bosche At one Refugee camp women & Girls are streaming in & from the age of 12 are all in the Family way. The huns had a camp

full of women with Pox when they left they liberated these poor creatures & as they were starving a lot of the
Entry.177: Divi caught it through giving them food & being kind to them the Girls reciprocated in the only way the & there you are. This place is a mass of ruins, unlike the Towns we have come through for here the last stand on this front was made & it was mostly our shells that did the damage It was bombarded 3 times & Bombed 3 little Boys eldest about 9 were telling us yesterday that one of their mothers had just had a turn. An old woman & little girl came walking in yesterday looking for their home but found it a heap of rubble, Poor things sat down in the mud & started to moan & cry when the Boys took her away & gave her Tea & food & this happens all day long the Lorries are full of returning french & belgiums who have been Prisoners of Years. In the Towns coming here, at night time when the People heard us marching, out went their lights the fear is still on them of the hun altho/ they know that hun is gone. & when they invite you to have coffee with them they stand round waiting on you such is 4 years slavery. They are delighted to see us & are all smiles but what Tragedy lies behind it all.
Entry.178: Last night we slept in a ruined house with the water dripping in everywhere Rained all day & night & looks like it again to day. half the house fell in but no one was hurt thought it was a mine going up & altho/ tired to death couldn’t sleep after it. Came 12 kilos Yesterday on cobbles & raw metal my feet are nearly done for & I think to day will finish me. We are near Le Cateau & to day go almost 6 miles. £64-18-0 £4-5-10 Pat Shelly off to Blighty on leave his
Entry.179: Rations to day Biscuits & Jam, the officers could get a case of whiskey last night tho/. left here 10-30 a.m. got here 2.P.m about 12 kilos came through Cortillon, Fismes, This place Sacce. done up again not tired but feet awful cobbles again just bathed them in cold water & Put Iodine on them bit better. In cellar here.
Entry.180: Cold frosty night fine morning, staying here a few days for a rest I suppose (Le S’art.). Big fog coming up. This place was shelled by the British but not much damage done, coming along found the hedges cut down as by a huge knife it was machine gun Bullets across the road. Writing to Viv today. will have to do them all. £64-19-6 £4-8-4. am only going to draw a little 20 francs next Pay until I get enough for Paris. shifted out of cellar last night to upstairs in big house much better.
Entry.181: Wrote to Viv & Manager Com Bank Sydney. Posted them yesterday. Heavy frost last night but have got a fire here. Brazier first this winter. not moving to day so my feet have another chance. Sun shining. $65-1-0 £4-10-10.
Entry.182: 1915 men up to June leaving us this morning ought not to be long before going now very cold & cloudy like snow still in the same Place no word of moving £65-2-6 £4-13-4.
Entry.183: Raining, wrote & Posted letters to Viv & Jack sent Jacks to Hobart don’t know where they are, got Parcel from Viv Tobacco, Cigs, Pie, cake, P.Puddy/ Lollies etc. good old chap cigs a God send. Pay day to day but can’t buy anything no shops, canteens empty. Lot of chaps gone away this morning some to Aussie, Base, & England £65-4-0 £4-15-10. got Bosker home here hope we dont move to soon. Paid 70 francs £2-13-8 Bal £2-4.2
Entry.184: Still raining, moving again shortly rumour that 1915 men are all to be away at end of month & the rest in 90 days. changed Tobacco for Cigs. £65-5-6 £2-6-10. Wrote to Syd & Posted it Still raining & heavy fog Cinema show on to night but not going. Boys start salvaging tomorrow.
Entry.185: Rain stopped for a little while, took Particulars at B.G.R. age etc. may be home again in 3 months. £65-7-0. £2-9-4. Bought some sauce 2 ½ francs. Boot Polish ½ franc. finished Cake & Plum Pudding last night. Jim Jewell sick again. Wrote & Posted letter to Al Carroll.
Entry.186: foggy, cloudy & cold this morning but clearing up now 11 a.m. staying here another week Jim went to Hospital this morning think he’s a gonner this time. £65-8-6. £2-11-10. Wrote to Viv & Posted it.
Entry.187: Another fine day & quite mild, wonderful weather for this time of the year, not iron frosts. Must be the reaction from gun fire. guns about here fire during the day Practice I suppose. £65-10-0. £2-14-4. We are in full regimental swing to day Bugles for everything even letters Band up the start at 7.am. Revielle. what next. am going to find out about bookkeeping classes may as well take it on may come in handy Wrote my last letter to Mrs H. on Nov. 5/18.
Entry.188: A glorious morning like Spt in Aussie. Soft warm Breeze & sun shining, can’t believe its midwinter only one frost since we have been here, friday week. Cpt/. Gibblett given send off last night, off to Australia to day. £65-11-6 £2-16-10. dark at 4-30 daylight at 6-30. go to bed at about 8-30 or 9. sometimes at 6. get up at 7-30. Food much better now Boys ought to get fat on it. Rumour that 25 1915 men out of each company go to Aussie next week am sure to be in it if so, but have me doubts. did some washing yesterday. Big mail in they say, wonder if there is anything for me.
Entry.189:
Still very mild but fine rain falling, expected to be on the move this morning but nothing doing, just as well. Australian Mail in nothing for me so no more letters. £65-13-0 £2-19-4. W.D.

off this day week to Mauberg about 3 days march our winter quarters Corps going to Namuer. turned out fine again sun shining cool wind blowing.
Entry.190: Letters yesterday from Nell 1 & card Carol 2 Jack card Syd 1. Arthur 1. Mrs Parsons 1 & card. also Parcel cake from Min Girdler through Yathella Comforts fund. Heavy fog last night cloudy & cold this morning north wind blowing. £65-14-6. £ 3-1-10. wrote & Posted letters to Jack, Carol & Mrs Parsons.
Entry.191: Cold & Wet. Yesterday Boys did Route March to get them ready for the Big March £65-16-0 £ 3-3-4. Wrote & Posted letters to Syd & Arthur.
Entry.192: Raining still, all day yesterday also what a lovely march we will have, my other parcels haven’t come to light yet hope they don’t arrive till after the march now. Have to carry one Blanket this time. £65-17-6 £3-5-10. no letter writing to day.
Entry.193: gale Blowing all night kept off rain but wind gone down a bit this morning & rain starting again roads washed clean of mud nothing startling to record £65-19-0 £3-8-4.
Entry.194: fine morning but cloudy the wonderful mild weather still continues Went to Fismes for a Court Martial this morning Bill & Rae with me 2 Germans. Off on Tuesday by all accounts, & better billets where we are going (Asconis) I think it is £66-0-6 £3-10-10.
Entry.195: dull but fine warm wind still blowing if this is a sample of winter in Europe theres not much to squeak about have felt it much colder in Sydney in July. £66-2-0 £3-13-4. feeling pretty queer pain in left breast & between shoulder Blades felt like fainting yesterday afternoon on coming back from Fismes. must see Dr tomorrow if not any better
