Entry.196: Raining again cold northerly wind, did not go to Dr/ this morning felt a bit better but pain coming on again under shoulder blade. Our schools broken up moving soon now. Pay day to day. not drawing anything £66-3-6. £3-15-10. Wrote & Posted letter to Viv.
Entry.197: raining & cold went to Dr/ he says I have Bronchitis knew something like that was the matter off tomorrow don’t know how I am not going to walk it & don’t mean to try. £66-5-0 £3-18-4.
Entry.198: fearful morning blinding rain & wind & cold first touch of winter up here since we arrived up at 6.30 a.m. Breakfast. fell in at 8-50 & off, came through Presches, & Cartigney to here Boulogne not Boulogne near Calais Rained in torrents all the way, all soaked, about 12 Kilos, the distance. Bronchitis better to day got a ride on G.S. waggon off again tomorrow about the same distance. £66-6-6 £4-0-10. Snow for certain tonight. got cosy billet with an elderly Frenchman who lives here by himself. Wind howling outside like a lot of demons.
Entry.199: Up at 6.15 Bks off at 8-45. fearful night last night bitter cold wind blowing & Raining. Rain kept off for the march, Snow storm just after we arrived first this Year. at least first this winter. Got my Pack & equipment carried & marched all the way 12 kilos except for my feet being very tired am a.1. got my chest & back rubbed last night. Off Tomorrow to our destination 20 Kilos away. £66-8-0 £4.3-4. this place is a large Town (manufacturing) (Sains.)
Entry.200:
up at the same time same procedure off on 20 Kilos jaunt. Raining hard, cold as ice. Last Town in France we came through Liessies Am in Belgium 

now, crossed the Border 10 to 12 noon. We are now quartered in Sivry in Belgium Town of 2500 inhabitants, Rotten Billets are here for the duration & a dam fine spot it is to finish up with, here we are about 14 of us in a Big Room no fire & the middle of winter. Am very tired got my Pack carried or couldn’t have done it. £66-9-6 £4-5-10

Saturday21/12/18

shortest day in the year. Now that we are here of course the weather has turned fine; this morning splendid & not cold Men all going off about the billets, believe one Bat/ goes out today to make more room, hope we all move, rotten hole General Hobbs says it won’t do his troops. £66-11-0 £4-8-4 Dance to night. forgot to mention that we have passed smashed jerry limbers by the doz also burnt out motor waggons, ambulances etc. All the Bridges were blown up & Railways also all cross Roads had a mine in them, Trees were felled all across the road up to the Blge Border, on this side little damage was done except in the beginning of the war. A lot of houses were shelled here in 1914.
Entry.201: Cold & cloudy, church Parade. 54 & 56th moving out to day, make more room for us. £66-12-6 £4-10-10 Wrote to Jack & Viv Posted them Just been out pinching wood in the rain this time 3 years ago was sitting at home waiting for Nell to come home after seeing Mary about a hat. the hat was of more importance than me hence----. Just got a cake from Hobart from Al. it is a beauty & 14 of us have had a go at it already.
Entry.202:
5Pm. This time 3 years ago was just going through the Heads Sydney. Have certainly seen something since. Wonder when I will enter the Heads again Raining in torrents all day, warned at 11 am to Pack up & leave in an hour, warned again about 6 times but still here just got our Blankets back so here for the night. Lovely Army ours.

 

our Heads ought to try their hand at running a wheelbarrow works. off Tomorrow about 10 Kilos thought this was the finish but what can one expect. Got a lovely cake from Hobart still a little left & 14 of us had a good go at it . £66-14-0 £4-13-4. Letters tonight from Nell 2 Jack 2 Arthur 1. Syd 1. & Grace Brs/ £1. good old G.Bs/.
Entry.203: up at 6a.m. white frost, moon shining also stars. BK at 7. fell in 8.30 & off to here 7 Kilos to Rance A much better town than last & much cleaner was a Hun Head Qrs once & plenty of women. Sun shining quite hot what a change & altho/ I carried my full Pack etc did it easily in 1 ½ hours. feel very fit ground hard as iron, This Place has streets all cobbled all the People turned out to meet us. At the last place Sivry the huns burned down 80 houses & the church took the first 16 civis they came across & put them up against the wall & shot them this was to put Terror into them. otherwise they left them alone & if the women took the soldiers on well that was their look out. A Tommy was shot in the street at 5 minutes to 11 on the 11th Nov Armistice day stiff luck. Am finding out that half & more of the women who took on germans took them voluntarily. Tomorrow Xmas day cant realize it, last Year it was all snow & freezing today quite hot & we were about 200 miles south of here. £66-15-6 £ 4-15-10 must write some letters to day if I get a chance but not to Nell give her time to think it over, every letter whining to get to Hobart.
Entry.204:
cloudy but not cold. Last night at 6 was sent for to go & get Beer for the Troops for to day Got a G.S. Waggon & off we went to Fra Chapelle 4 Kilos away none of us knew the road etc etc raining when we left came on to snow when about a Kilo away & snowed till we got back, lovely trip on a dark night & curses well what do you think. Got 9 casks of 25 gals all for 230 Francs. cheap. Am off duty today for it. The ground is all white with snow but it is not cold & theres a lot more coming. £66-17-0 £4-18-4.

wrote to Jack P Cards to Nell, Tony & Carol. Pat Shelley Back.
Entry.205: fine day again but snow last night & very cold on the hands. Had 2 Benedictines this morning. Great dance last night given by the civies but did not go. Posted letter to Jack with cards for the others. Had another lot of Xmas Pudding last night very rich also cold Ham & Beef & Pickles so not so bad after all. Boys behaving themselves thank goodness. £66-18-6 £5-0-10
Entry.206: Cold, wet & snow Bitter wind blowing. Big Parade for lecture on V.D. Boys to have a good time etc etc will soon be going home now £67-0-0 £5-3-4 wrote to Mrs Holdaway, Al Carrol, Grace Bros/ London, J Jewell. Just got another Bonzer Parcel from Al.
Entry.207: Raining in torrents good day for writing have written to Arthur, Yathella Comforts Fund, Grace Bros/ Comfort Fund & Maude finished now for a week Bill Snoddy gone to Amiens for Woods. Pay tomorrow. £67-1-6 £5-5-10. about 15 gone to Aussie to day cpt Giblett, Hanson , Nev Cole etc. next Batch 12th Jany. Been to B.O.R. & signed repatriation Papers. They tell me I should get away soon now. Lent Bill Snoddy 20 francs.
Entry.208: Raining still but not cold, a little snow last night £67-3-0 £5-8-4. Posted all my letters this morning. Pay day tomorrow.
Entry.209: Pay day got 100 francs 40 for Bill Snoddy last day for changing hun money. £67-4-6. £5-10-10 less 3-16-8 = 1-14-2
Entry.210: Cold & cloudy, Bill not back yet, no Parade this morning but one yesterday, went for long walk to keep fit Dance last night, looked in for 5 minutes £67-6-0 £1-16-8. out all day taking porcelain etc. to to Esk keeping hours for soldiers, Brothels everywhere, the sooner the diggers get out of here the better.
Entry.211: quite cold this morning, Put in for leave to Brussells 2 to go from H.Qtrs hope I get it have got 135 francs. Great to do last night Band playing at ½ Past 11 to 12 old Lang Syne etc. Flares + cheering & howling, but soon died down. £67-7-6, £1-19-2. wrote to Maude, Al, nurse Morpeth, Manager Com/ Bank London & Jack Posted them. Dance to night.
Entry.212: Very cold wind blowing expect snow, hear there is a blood test for all men going home, if not satisfactory must stay another 12 months some of them will be stiff. nothing to do only walk about Parade lasts about 20 minutes each morning. £67-9-0 £2-1-8. There is church here nearly every day & the People are all well dressed their Boots being very fashionable.
Entry.213: Cold wind & cloudy no snow yet. Some gone to Brussells on Leave Ray gone on escort & Bill not back yet. £67-10-6 £2-8-4. Wrote to Viv.
Entry.214: Raining in torrents, Bill not back yet. Rumour that 1915 go on the 10th hope so. £67-12-0. £2-5-10 Joe Lawson went to Brussells Yesterday. No incorrect. Bill came back at 4.30 P.M. had been to Charleau, Mons, Val, C, Etables, Allende & Amiens.
Entry.215: Still raining Officers had dance last night all the Elite there rained all night. Belgium goes into mourning Tomorrow for 6 months. £ 67-13-6. £2-8-4. lent Bill another 40 francs 60 altogether.
Entry.216: fearful night gale Blowing, very cold this morning, short arm Parade, Wet canteen opening today Pat Shelly in charge. £67-15-0. £2-10-10. Posted letter to Viv & Paper to Jack yesterday.
Entry.217: C.Gs orders on 1045 words. Ray going to Charlervi on Escort. Hear we are leaving here for Ton’d-chapelle. £67-16-6 £2-13-4. Wrote & Posted letter to Nell thought it best to let her know my movements.
Entry.218: mild moonlight night last night, getting colder this morning. Told by Officer that we 1915 men are leaving for home by the 12th. £67-18-0. £2-15-10 Wrote to Newton congratulating him on getting the Islington Seat. Letters 1 each from Viv & Syd.
Entry.219: Boys did not get away this morning for Aussie go tomorrow I go in the 3rd Batch about 26th. Beautiful day yesterday sun quite hot. today raining like hell. £67-19-6. £2-18-4. Wrote to Viv & Syd Posted them.
Entry.220: Wrote & Posted letter to Mrs Burgess Salisbury. Very cold this morning, People here say hancoup snow in Feb. Chaps got away to day 16 of them, next lot on the 12th. £68-1-0 £3-0-10. Concert last night & to night. am going
Entry.221: Went to Concert & enjoyed it fine A real good turnout "The Kooka burrahs" the 3rd entertainment I have been to since coming to France. 6 officers went away for Aussie this morning Maj. Stubsbury, Juls Mathews Lts/ Wilson, Pie, Holder etc. Another Batch on the
Entry.223: mild again to day, church Parade, dance tonight Sunday over here is a gala day dances in the Boozers Piano organs going etc. Another Party going tomorrow wish I was with them getting fed up & miserable, but then again what am I going back to. Pay day tomorrow £68-4-0 £3-5-10. when Bill Sneddy Pays me the 60 francs he owes me I shall have £9-0-5.
Entry.224:
Fog this morning first here, no one sent away this morning, Band gone to 

Divi for a week. Pat & Bill on escort for Belgium Bank to Charlein, Pay tomorrow Bill Paid me 50 francs. £68-5-6 £3-10-0 Just got orders to go to Charlein on Escort.

Tuesday14.Wednesday15.Thursday16
Entry.225:
quite mild again got back yesterday at 4 pm. Lorri to Grand Run then Ger Boat 10 kilos. had an ‘ell of a time. Grand Place Charlein . Had a breakdown near Bramont & had to wait 3 Hours for another , car getting into Charlein at 9 Pm. finest sight I have seen, all lit up with electricity & Trams everywhere. Put Prisoners in Barracks for safety slept on Boards on a Bed with only overcoat on . next day took Birds to Station to hand over to another escort &had to wait for 5 hours there two of the birds trying to get away all the time enjoyed myself I dont think. Got rid of them at 5 P.m. then went up town & got Room at Hotel 5 francs. Steak & chips 5 francs. everything fearfully dear got some caramels about 8 for 3 francs & so on, went to see Wax Works shall never forget it. Had a good time cost me about 140 francs but dont mind that should soon be going home now Letters from Syd 1 Nell 2 Jack 1. Will Stewart 1. Bought Views of Lorrain, Canbrai, Brussells & Charlein. Must write home today. Paid 70 francs on Monday Bill Snoddy Paid me 10 f. he owed me. Have about 80 francs now & £1-6-4 in Bank. £68-11-6

Wrote to Nell, Carol, Jack, Tony Post cards to Mrs Girdler
Entry.226: have got 79 francs left. £68-13-0 £1-8-10 cold raw morning but lovely night last night thieves pretty bad here stole 4 horses 2 saddles 3 Bridles night before last. Wrote & Posted letters to Syd, Will Stewart, Nell Post cards to Nell, Jack Tony & Carol to 70 Bridge Rd
Entry.227: white frost & heavy fog, cold raw morning, weather on the change. £68-14-6. £1-11-4.
Entry.228: good news at last my name is down for the next draft. leave here on the 25th for Blighty. dont feel excited in the least. £68-16-0 £1-13-10. Wrote to Viv & Posted it
Entry.229: lovely morning, big frost but mild, no wind Court of Inquiry about the 4 horses stolen was Court Orderly £68-17-6 £1-16-4.
Entry.230:
Bonzer Morning, not a cloud, hard frost. more comforts last night, getting shortages tomorrow. £68-19-0 £1-18-10. Letter from Maude & Papers & Magazines. Pay tomorrow. Wrote to Maude.

Thursday 23/1/19

off Tomorrow instead of Saturday. Snowing hard at last. Have to march 9 kilos tomorrow. £69-0-6. £2-1-4. Writing to Syd & Viv. Mrs Parsons Posted them. Paid up to 31st 70 francs

Friday 24/1/19

off this morning at 9. fell in at 9. moved off at 9-30. for Beaumont 12 1/2

 kilos did it in a little over 2 hours. Bitterly cold even with overcoat on & gloves felt it marching at that Pace Snow stopped but heavy frost + keen wind Got here Beaumont little after 12 a bit foot sore cobbles all the way. Big crowd of us. 8th 14 &
Entry.231: Brigades had a look round but nothing interesting except an old castle & Fort built about 1000 years ago walls 6 ft. thick crumbling to decay now. On the top of it one of fritzs tripods for his machine gun. Getting to bed early in big factory (woolen). all machinery left here. Something unusual for Fritz £69-2-0
Entry.233: Brigade lot left this morning We go tomorrow still fearfully cold. Glad when we get out of this. £69-3-6.
Entry.234:
off this morning at 10. Snowing, Bitterly cold. trip takes about 7 days. what are we in for £69-5-0 .

 Left at 12-30 Passed some towns, (above), got to station about 4 kilos outside of Charlein & stayed there till after 9. 3 hours. Then out & walked it got to bed at 12-30 midnight in big Factory Electrolytic Belonging to King Leopold slept on

cement floor with only water Proof & 1 blanket outside all snow & still snowing.
Entry.235:
up at 5 a.m. got to a fire for a warm. BK one Piece of bread & Jam off at 8 for Train, left Charlein about 9. Ground covered with snow & Boys snowballing everyone they meet. Journey takes about 5 days. We are in Horse trucks with small stove so not so bad. £69-6-6 £2-15-10

La Conygen, La Louveire, La Paix, Bracquegniex, Reinn, Obourg, Nimy, Mons.
Entry.236: In France & at Woai I think Bombed houses again Its in France where you see where the war has been. #163;69-8-0. £2-16-4. Courchelette, Arrass a fine station & city all shot to pieces. Not understood unless seen 5 Pm near Bupaime but will be too dark to see it plenty of snow on the ground yet but stopped.
Entry.237: came through these Serqueux, Snow everywhere sight lovely, came through Albeville, Etaples & then Harve Monternuex, Heathville, Yuetot to Hasfleur where we got to camp at about 3 P.m. 53 hours in the Train from Charlein. got two Blankets £69-9-6 £2-18-10
Entry.238: Got 2 sets of Underclothing new. & had steam Bath & cold shower ugh. leave tomorrow for England no time to go to Le Harve. £69-11-0 £3-1-4. great camp this Y M.C.A. Huts, cinema, canteen Salvation Canteens etc. Red Cross Recreation Rooms Billiards etc. B.E.F. Canteen Wet etc etc. camped in Tents.
Entry.241:
Ye gods what a trip got here last night, left Hasfleur at 8 Pm. was at Picture show & were all dragged out the ground a sloping one was

covered with thin ice & you couldn’t stand on it men were falling all over the place as there were only a few lights it was lively got away at last on march to Le Harve 10 kilos got there covered in sweat sleet falling & had to wait till 3 a.m. before we could go on Board The Boys found Boxes & wood & soon 21 fires were going otherwise we would have frozen Scarred the nurses in a hospital close handy. A crowd of Canadians went away before us & had a band to play them off. Then we were herded on board & there was not standing room hardly. The trip across was rough & most were pretty bad got some cocoa & Biscuits at about 10 a.m. £69-12-6. £3-3-10 less correct amount 2-13-3
Entry.242:
correct amount 8/8 in credit.

Arrived at Weymouth at about 12 noon marched off to Army & Navy Canteen & given cake & tea changed our money & then on to another Branch of Canteen & got Paper bag of food for the Train splendid of them. on to the train & off to here Hurcot got off at Wilton & marched 5 miles getting here soaked in sweat got tucker & off to bed dead beat. Sleet still falling £69.14-0. £-11/4. 

Up this morning about 9. Bk. Parade to sort us out etc We get our leave on Thursday. have written to Bank & will go to London. Nothing much doing had a short arm Parade etc. £69-15-6. 13/10.

Monday 3/2/19

Wrote to Nell Viv & Bank Posted them last night. not quite so cold this morning Getting our clothes to day. Get 16 inspections while here. £69-17-0 16/4. Wrote to Maude Posted it got the rest of our clothes to day.

Tuesday 4/2/18

Getting Paid to day, milder than usual Rain about. £69-18-6 £-18-10. Paid £4-10-0 to do for 14 days leave, have to Pay Post fare to London 8/2 & this is what a grateful country does for you, wish they would get us out of the damned hole they have no use for us now that the hun does not threaten them. In debt £3-11-2

Wednesday 5/2/19

Rain & snow all night same this morning cold no name for it, hear we leave by end of this month. Went J.M. Picture show last night. Wrote to Mrs Burgess last night. £70-0-0 & £3-8-8. have got £7- for my 14 days leave. snow all day
Entry.243: should have gone to London to day but Strike on Railways stopped us after getting everything ready dont wish them any harm but dam them. Here we are 90 miles from London & 5 from the Railway & nothing to do. Bill got away last night for Ireland but expect he is held up. his mother is dying too. £70-1-6. £3-6-2. owe.
Entry.244: Snow all gone big thaw set in Yesterday but very cold. Strike still on & we are here indefinitely. I’d like to have my way for one day with those strike agitators. that’s all. £70-3-0 £3-3-8.
Entry.245: Warned last night at 10 to go on leave 4 a. m. this morning 18 degrees of frost
Entry.246: In London at last 20 degrees of frost what oh
Entry.247: Tuesday Wednesday Thursday Friday Saturday Sunday.
Entry.248: Fog ever since & Raining got my glasses at last last full of Reeking London am off on Wednesday for Salisbury.
Entry.249: off to Camp to day 5-15 Train had enough of all this dam glag to get out of it
Entry.250:
Back at Camp at last got here last night & if I had £100 on me wouldn’t go to London again. For one week it was like the north Pole then came the fogs & rain with snow with it at night if you went out & turned a corner

without noticing it you were lost.. Got lost every night then the rush & noise of Traffic gets on your nerves. Managed to get back with about 15/- & where the next is coming from dont know 

Due £1-3-8 £71-7-0 more later, nerves all astray. Thank God the sun shines here & the air is clear Another week of the fog etc would have killed me no wonder People die of influenza etc there. Got letters from Viv. Nell, Jack Mrs Girdler, Arthur last Tuesday must answer them tomorrow Nell & Boys gone to Hobart as I expected dont know how I will get on now.
Entry.251:
feeling alright again but not quite nerves still Jangled Writing home this afternoon. £1-1-2 £71-8-6. fine morning tho cloudy but after London lovely. Wrote to Nell & Viv Posted them also Syd.

Tuesday 25/2/19

a lovely morning no clouds, Nippy, but no frost. 18/8 £71-10-0. Short Arm this morning. Wrote to Jack & Mrs Girdler. Posted them. Our chaps go on Guard & Picket to day out of it myself. got Post Card from Mrs Burgess Salisbury Posted on the 5th 20 days to get here. Been a grand day & spring is in the air.
Entry.252: Am orderly Cpl to day glad to have something to do. Wrote to Mrs Burgess yesterday. Will be here a month or 6 weeks at earliest. Rained during the night & snow this morning fine climate this. 16/2 £71-11-6 Writing to Maude Bill & Pat both on Guard. Got Pay Books Back to day am
Entry.253: in debt on the 28th Posted letter to Maude. finished up at 9.
Entry.254: Cold but fine again wrote to Carol & Posted it this finishes the series. nothing to do to day getting very monotonous. £71-13-0. Princess Pat married to day.
Entry.255: white frost. £71-14-6 owe 12/4. Bickest Beat Wells last night. wonder how Princess Pat got on Rumours that No 9. Camp going in a few days. Paid 20/- Owe 32/4. A lovely day sun shining & quite warm hope this infernal winter is over.
Entry.256: Beast of a day cold raw wind, heavy frost this morning more snow coming. £71-16-0 owe 29/10. Boys on fatigue this morning. Rumour that we go about end of month. Parcel from dear old Al been to Belgium cocoa all split but saved ½ a tin. had some to night Bonzer.
Entry.257: Windy but fine heavy rain during the night, much milder. £71-17-6. 27/4. thank goodness my neck has filled out looked a scarecrow before & about 70 years old. writing to Syd. wrote to Syd & Al Carroll Posted them
Entry.258: Been Raining during the night but stopped now wind still blowing great guns but quite mild 4 days leave next Friday shall go to Salisbury. £71-19-0. 24/10. Letter from Mrs Burgess, Son & Daughter demobilized. no Rum
Entry.259: Rained all night & still raining set in for a month. Not going now till middle of July so rumour says. £72-0-6 22/4. this is getting on our nerves. Fellows acting the goat like kids of 8 & 10 dont know what to do with themselves been away from Bat/. 5 weeks now & here a month last Saturday.
Entry.260: two letters from Syd tells me Nell went off without even saying anything to Jean or him nice woman £72-2-0 – 19/10 Raining still & likely to inoculated again to day double doses. Wrote to Viv
Entry.261: Rain stopped last night awful frost this morning freezing at 9 a.m. coldest morning I have felt here. Put in for some cigarettes to day got 100 Yesterday 2/1 £72-3-6. 17/4. Not feeling the inoculation much. Lecture this afternoon.
Entry.262: Raining again great country this. wrote Post Cards to Syd & Jack Posted them. £72-5-0. – 14/10. very cold night. Rumour that we go on the 20th . I dont think. Rained all day. Canadians playing up in Wales.
Entry.263: Rain stopped but not for long. got my washing very cheap here 1 shirt 1 undershirt, 1 under Pants, 1 sox 7. takes all our money to buy food here, worst we have had yet. costs me about 1/6 to 2/- a day. This crowd will be breaking out next, £72-6-6. – 12/4.
Entry.264: No 9. Camp left today for Aussie 12 & 8 next on the 14th then us. Raining again. £72-8-0 – 9/10 went to Pictures last night "Sea Wolf". on duty tonight Fire Picquet.
Entry.265: Strong cold wind blowing also a little rain another riot in London Yanks this time. whats up with the Aussies. mail expected to day. £72-9-6 – 7/4. Pay day on the 15th. 3 letters from Nell 1 Jack 1 Tony. Raining all day.
Entry.266: Still raining hard been at it all night. I think it is settled that we go this month 20 boats going. Must say that Nells letters a bit more pleasant perhaps its because she is amongst her own People but what I am going to do about that stored furniture the Lord only knows. £72-11-0 – 4/10 owe. Wrote to Nell hope things will be alright now. Expect her next letter will be a snorter. wrote to Tony altho/ he dont deserve it.
Entry.267: Parade at 9-30. Route March Rain stopped for a few minutes £72-12-6. 2/4. Posted letter to Tony. Wrote to Jack. Posted it. going to be fine
Entry.268: heavy white frost, got out & had hot shower Bath at 6-30. a lovely morning but clouding over again 12 noon Bill & I went for a walk to Barford St/ Martin, Had a cup of tea & sandwiches. Got some comforts Yesterday cakes & plum Puddings, Nuts, sweets, sox. £72-14-0 in credit 2 Pay on Friday. Wrote & Posted it to Carol. Got Xmas Box Queensland Comfort Funds.
Entry.269: Another white frost & lovely morning but clouding up again getting Paid 20/- £72-15-6 credit 2/8. got another bad cold, sneezing my head off. owe 17/4 now had to go to bed at last feel very crook.
Entry.270: Frost again & lovely morning, heavy clouds coming up- got Pint of Beer & made it hot last night & altho/ did not sleep all night am much better to day had a Parade the new Genr/ in charge of Aussies over here told us all about Boats etc and the 5th Divi go to Weymouth 8 boats go away for Aussie by the 25th We may be amongst that lot but doubt it. £72-17-0 14/10. Wrote & Posted letters to Maude, Arthur, Amro Williams & Trustee Coy.
Entry.271:
cold raw morning sun trying to shine. Went to Pictures last night Bill S. got a flask of whiskey from Ireland Yesterday We had it last night & it did my cold good. Got pair of Sox from Grace Bros/. £72-18-6 12/4 Wrote & Posted letters to Mrs Parsons & Viv

Monday 17/3/19

St Pats day got some shamrock from Bill sent him from Ireland, sending it to Hobart. a small frost & very cold this morning, cold a bit better. £73 - 9/10. did not go out all day yesterday 8 & 12 Camp leaving this day week. Wrote & Posted letter to Nell for final decision sent her shamrock.

Tuesday 18/3/19

frost & lovely morning not raining now 3 P.m. actually 4 days fine have not been out for 3 days. cold better. £73-1-6 7/4 leaving here
Entry.273: Rained in torrents all night & still Raining 1.P.m. in for another week of it. Just had dinner suet Pudding Pie, Hair oil Rice. Nothing fresh Yet about going away. £73-3-0 – 4/10 Bitterly cold day & Raining still 6 Pm. got 200 cigs.
Entry.274: Rained all night turning to snow this morning Country white. Going to see Stonehenge this afternoon per motor car still snowing. Hear we leave about the end of the month. £73-4-6. – 2/4 Had great trip per motor to Stonehenge & home through Salisbury. Its a wonderful old Relic "Stonehenge" built 1800 Years before Christ it was erected as a Temple to the Sun God & is circular in formation The Rocks were brought at least 25 to 30 miles but were first of all shaped then brought on Rollers. The largest of them would weigh about almost 40 to 60 Tons ea. The trip cost 3. Hear we leave on the
Entry.275: & all leave is cut out. Passed the Earl of Pembrokes Castle a fine Place at Wilton went through Park Hill Camp. Huge aerodrome
Entry.276:
cold & cloudy but trying to be fine sun shining now & then. Coal miners won their case so perhaps one strike over £73-6-0 Credit 2 Went to Pictures. Concert Party tonight.

Saturday 22/3/19

Snowing again this morning & the Papers told us Yesterday that spring had set in . Am afraid our 4 days leave is off wont give us any money. £73-7-6 – 2/8.

Sunday 23/3/19

Snow again this morning, heavy frost first thing, £73-9-0. – 5/2. Went to Pictures

Monday 24/3/18

fearfully cold wind blowing, cloudy but fine, getting Paid for our 4 days leave Am going to Salisbury. £73-10-6. – 7/8. took some more washing to get done. Paid 30/- in debt again
Entry.278:
Crowd up at 5 Bks/. 5-15. went back to bed again & got up at 9 & off Br Boot to Salisbury got a lift for 2 miles 8 miles altogether. Bed 2/- din 2/- been over Cathedral fine old building built in 1248 & very well preserved going to see Mrs Burgess.

this afternoon £73-12-0 – in debt.
Entry.279: very cold wind blowing. Amiens Cathedral built same time. Went to 2 Picture shows very good. Streets not lit up at night got lost going home. Worse than our country towns for light.
Entry.280: lovely morning going to see Mrs Burgess. off back tomorrow. £73-13-6. –
Entry.281: called on Mrs Burgess to night 7-30 Very nice people & seem well off.
Entry.282: off back after dinner, rained this morning tho/ fine now £73-15-0 -14/10 heard we are on a Boat Roll at last so may go the end of the month. Met some of the Boys yesterday whiskey & stout galore. Trip so far only cost one 20/- got here about 4 Pm. in time for Tea. very tired.
Entry.283: named for guard, cold wind still blowing, a little sleet, dont feel too good to day. £73-16-6 – 12/4 Concert on tonight am going looks like Rain
Entry.284: lovely sight this morning 6 inches of snow & the sun shining started raining last night then came the snow about 2 a.m. missed going on guard after all still crook. Concert very good last night. Lot of chaps did not come home. £73-18-0 – 9/10. Broke. heaviest fall of snow hereabouts this winter been lovely day with sun shining all day snow still lying deep all over. Clocks go back one hour to night. No mail for me one letter from Trustee Coy. only. Going to Pictures with Bill to-night.
Entry.285: Snow still thick on the ground & a bitterly cold wind blowing altho/ the sun is shining Our chaps on guard again, groaning like hell over it. £73-19-6. –
Entry.286:
feel much better to day. Another snow storm to day about 12 noon very heavy expect we shall have some more. Our names gone in for Boat Roll at last. A little more snow this evening. 

Monday 31/3/19

Short Arm inspection this morning several men caught with scabies on them & isolated. Still very cold wind coming off the snow. leaving either on the 5th or 7th they tell one. £74-1-0 – 4/10. will write when I get the name of the Boat. Boats name Tros-os-Menkes Wrote Post Cards to Maude, Nell, Jack, Carol, Tony, Syd & Viv.

Tuesday 1/4/19

lovely morning, heavy frost, snow nearly all gone. getting final Pay to day no more till we reach Aussie after. £74-2-6 – 2/4. it’s getting exciting at last, going next Monday. Paid 3-15-0 to end of Apl. Going Sunday now. Posted letters. some more snow.
Entry.287:
cold but fine, cloudy. got cards to sign where letters are to go to had mine sent to Syd. Won crib tournament this morning 12/- £74-4-0. £2 in hand. Bill & I going to Pictures, lovely afternoon. 3-14-10

Thursday3/4/19

a beautiful morning, heavy frost, no wind & Sun hot. the first really spring morning yet. Everyone getting excited over 2000 going in our Boat so must be a big one. £74-5-6. - £3-12-4 Bill & I went to Barford this morning & had tea & some cakes. Went to Pictures post card to Mrs Parsons
Entry.288: Heavy clouds & colder rain coming. getting all things necessary for voyage Printing names on Bags etc. must get some Books. £74-7-0£3-9-10. am taking some lung mixture doing me good too. felt I was getting pneumonia a few days ago. Going for long walk this morning went to Barford & further called at the inn had 2 Port wines & 7 Pints of Stout Bonzer. got home at 10 P.m. feeling happy for once
Entry.289:
Muster-Roll this morning off on Monday early. Lovely morning Going into Salisbury by car today 5 of us. £74-8-6 £3-7-4. had a good time Salisbury. Went to Pictures in afternoon & Palace at night

a few drinks then supper & home by motor Girl driver & very nice one too. Bed about 10-30.
Entry.290: Our last day at Hurdcott, came round quicker than we thought 9 weeks here yesterday. time I got home. feeling very fresh. cloudy & like rain but we dont care if it Pours now. £74-10-0 £3-4-10. Getting our Boat tickets this morning and final medical inspection. thank goodness am o.k. Cold much better. Saw some of the Australian beasts last night no wonder the English People like us such Vermin ought to be shot. 5 Pm time getting on tomorrow reveille at 4 BK 5 off at 6 a.m. Black Bags have just been stacked for the motors to take away Just got some more cough mixture. Going to Rain. Went to Barford for usual.
Entry.291:
Up at ¼ to 5 BK fell in at 6. lovely morning but cloudy Train trip of 6 hours to Devonport. dont go till tomorrow £74-11-6 £3-2-4. 

4 Pm. are at Devonport came through Exeter & Tavistock also other towns at Exeter the Mayoress gave us a Bun each & cup of tea stayed 30 minutes. our Boat has broken down & goodness knows when we will get away other 2 trains sister ships to Queen Elizabeth.
Entry.292: still here in Devonport & on the Boat came aboard about 7. tea at 9. Bags out all here mine amongst the mobs. Hammocks so did not sleep to well. Will be here a couple of days yet, cover of Sylinder cracked. £74-13-0 £2-19-10. dont like the Boat much too top heavy for my liking expect a rough time in trip’s & food. The Warspite is being refitted up got here in sinking condition from Battle of Jutland.
Entry.293:
Still here but going to day sometime, cool & fine left the wharf at 3 Pm. crews of warships gave us 3 cheers as we passed

 

each vessel & we responded with a will got down opposite Plymouth & dropped anchor something wrong with Latrines also 400 have to go off in the morning Are here for 48hours. Nice Boat this I dont think. £74-14-6 £2-17-4. Got 18th Kt cargo today. food improving but up to Putty so far.
Entry.294: left at midnight & this morning found ourselves in the Atlantic & nearly everyone sick, heavy ground swell on was alright till dinner-time then Joined the majority. will be going through the Bay of Biscay takes 24hours to do it so expect it will be very rough there. Plenty of food today & no one to eat it. £74-16-0 £2-14-10. Its very cold & gale Blowing with slight rain.
Entry.295: Boys still very sick am A.1. myself had a good BKs and feel splendid not through the Bay yet but expect to be in a few hours. Plenty of fatigues going missed them all so far. £74-17-6. £2-12-4. Sun shining today altho cloudy. Just had a shave its ticklish work with the ship rolling & pitching.
Entry.296: lovely weather now we are through the Bay no rougher than going to Manly the sun very hot today glad to come down out of it Wind behind us. Band playing up above quite Picnicky. £74-19-0 £2-9-10. Am eating anything now Pork to day – two days Ugh. Calling at Port Said, Colombo, Freemantle, Melbourne & Sydney will write to catch mail at Melbourne.
Entry.297:
glorious weather wouldn’t know you were at sea if you did not see the water no movement at all only slight tremour from the screws. Up at 7. Land on either side going through the

the straits of Gibralta Abreast of the Great Rock at 9-30 Captain took us close in so that we could see it well a mighty Rock & fortress. no wonder the huns wanted Britain to give it up. Everyone quite well again have come 1000 miles in 3 ½ days. should be at Pt Said on Saturday. France still in sight on our left, but Africa out of sight now £75-0-6. £2-7-4.
Entry.298: Weather-still lovely, last night saw the most beautiful sunset I ever saw such colours could not be dreamt of . Band playing at the same time & other ships passing. Are keeping close to the African coast to day different Route to what we took when coming over £75-2-0£2-4-10. Pay day 22nd .Porpoises in plenty about here was watching them this morning at 6.30. All sorts of gambling going on Hazards, Toss up, murrumbidge, House, crown & anchor, Race game etc they will be playing marbles yet. Church Parade not a success yesterday. Got tin of fruit to day 1/- cigs 3^ a Pkt on board. in hand £1-19.0.
Entry.299: getting very hot near Malta now but not in sight yet. won 12/6 yesterday at crown & anchor. Passed a lot of vessels 8 mine sweepers also. The dolphins are great in front of the Boat gee whiz they can go some. £75-3-6 £2-2-4. Getting too warm down here to sleep at night was awake till 1 am. & up at 5-30. Short arm Parade yesterday 16 cases of V.D. No land in sight since midday yesterday, get to Port Said Friday night. Am feeling well but stuffed up with this nasal Catararrh.
Entry.300: glorious fine, hot weather still, Passed Malta last night Am just off Guard was Cpl of the G. won another 2/6. not feeling too good to day off Tucker £75-5-0. £1-19-10. Not getting off at Port Said but getting leave at Colombo.
Entry.301: Same beautiful weather nice soft warm Breeze in the distance on the Port side (left) are hills covered with snow must be Italy or Greece £75-6-6 - £1-17-4. took some salts last night & am much better to day, no exercise is the matter. Been gambling all day am still ahead of it.
Entry.302: Good Friday, church Parade, Ling for BKs. This time last year was at Aubigny near Villers Bretonneux where I was gassed on the 23rd Passed a French cruiser just awhile ago expect to get to Port Said tonight. £75-8-0 £1-17-4. have now in hand £2-18-2 won again yesterday.
Entry.303:
We are here at Port Said got here early about 3 a.m. a lively scene this Coaled 700 tons in about 4 hours these Gypos can work & no error, Some of them diving for money one fellow dived off the Bridge. Our boys in swimming , very hot our first taste of summer, but nice Breeze blowing The Ormonde, Aeneas, Valdivia & a Jap steamer Just come through great cheering & excitement when the Ormonde Passed us going to England. We leave here to day & should get to Colombo in about 10 or 12 days Bought some lovely oranges ‘2 ea) but worth it, like our naval oranges only larger did some washing had shower salt water.

its getting more exciting as we get nearer home. The Harbour is full of shipping 100s of Boats here One of the 2nd Divi died two days ago, a lot sick. Am trying to get Syd his cards Asked a civi who went Ashore to get some, we cant get leave here. £75-9-6. £1-14-10. £2-13-2. The Nestor with Troops the Peru Oil driven Boat Passed through also the Warwickshire Troopship with Aussies on Passed us as we were getting ready to leave Are off now ¼ to 7 P.m. Passing huge camp of Bell Tents must be over 1000 of them.
Entry.304: We are at Suez now ¼ to 10 a.m. Passed Canbarra last night all lit up with electric lights. seems to have plenty of improvements in the canal since we were here, Plenty of cheering & chaff on the Journey. Getting very hot & not feeling too bright dont get enough sleep. £75-11-0 £1-12-4. Passed the Warwickshire & wasn’t there some fun our Band played Good Bye & our chaps yelled themselves hoarse
Entry.305: fearfully hot, sleep naked at night The Breeze is behind us so we get no wind. expect to Pass Aden Tomorrow had my last sight of Mt/ Sinai Yesterday Our Boat Travelling much faster Getting 18 Knots out of her now Passed a lot of Boats Yesterday & last night Dental Parade to day 2 P.m. Get my teeth fixed up now. £75-12-6 £1-9-10. Tins of fruit gone up 1/4 1/- before. Have to get two teeth filled. Forgot to mention that a Riot occurred at Pt Said the day before we got there 19 Killed 50 wounded
Entry.306: Pay day to day. Saw the Southern Cross last night Just on the Horizon. In the shower at 5-30 this morning heat awful. less than 3 weeks ago we had 5 Blankets on us & two under Now go to Bed naked £75-14-0 £1-7-4.
Entry.307: Still very Hot, ship Broke down during the night doing only 9 knots some Engine terrible 2400 People on Board. Nice Breeze to day £75-15-6. - £1-4-10 Paid 30/- Yesterday. Am own £2-14-10. should get to Aden tonight. Southern Cross much Plainer last night. Will loose the Great Bear & North star by Tomorrow night. Men getting round naked. Engines fixed up again only lost about 50 miles
Entry.308: forgot to mention that there was a Riot at Port Said 19 killed & 50 wounded also big trouble in India expect to see Aden any hour now Islands & land on either side Passed the 12 Apostles Yesterday afternoon. The sea water much cooler this morning have £3-10-0 for Colombo must Buy Nell something. Had fruit for Tea last night. Lovely Breeze & nice & cool out of the sun, two Sunstroke cases so far. Theres talk of 400 being Put off at Colombo. too many on board & not enough capacity for water. Came through Hells’ Gates this morning £75-17-0 £2-12-4.
Entry.309: Anzac Day Service, Dead March, Last Post, sounded very sad. a lovely day & not quite so hot In charge of Fatigue Party got so hot had to have another - Bath. Gambling been stopped at last & a good thing too was getting disgraceful. £75-18-6 £2-9-10. well into the Indian Ocean now will be at Colombo on Wednesday. are off the coast of Abysinnia & have been all day. North East Africa.
Entry.310: Still fine hot weather with Breeze, getting very monotonous, shall be at Colombo next Wednesday night. out of sight of land now £76-0-0 £2-7-4. sport Yesterday & dinner at night for Officers with Band playing etc. Gambling still going on as usual.
Entry.311: Beautiful morning cloudy so not so hot & here we are broken down in mid-ocean stopped at 8 a. m. & likely to be drifting about for a day or so fancy sending Troops away on a Boat like this. She did the same with Yankee Troops aboard of her. £76-1-6. £2-4-10. Urinals & Latrines in a lovely state shouldn’t be surprised if sickness does not break out over it. have been getting about in shirt & Pants for a week & am almost as black as - Gypo. Church Parade just over, will get to Colombo about a week hence at this rate.
Entry.312: started again yesterday at 12 noon 4 hours drifting but all O.K. so far not near so hot but like a oven down here in the hold Mail closes tomorrow night so must be getting to Colombo on Wednesday night after all It will be great being able to stretch our legs ashore but it will be hellish hot there. £76-3-0 £2-2-4.
Entry.313: Sea like glass, fearfully Hot. nothing much to write about. 76-4-6. £1-19-10
Entry.314:
Engine trouble again going slow since 4.a.m. Get to Colombo tomorrow if----- Plenty of lightening last night & Rain all round us this morning but none on us £76-6-0 £1-17-4 

Meat for dinner awful, Rotten, Boys gathered it up in a hammock & Paraded with it up to Officers. Then Read the Burial service over it & emptied it into the sea the Bugler Blowing last Post. Heavy lightening to night
Entry.315: got here Colombo at 10-50. Heat terrific got off in the afternoon ashore sweat running out of me bought Bananas, Ice cream Ice drinks No Liquor on sale all Pubs shut Bought some Handkerchiefs for Nell. To night terrible storm Lightening very vivid & thunder awful. Sweat running out of us £76-7-6 £1-14-10
Entry.316: Still here melting the sanitary arrangements are awful on this boat No disinfectant for Latrines & the stench nearly knocks you down if we dont soon get out of the Tropics we will all be down with some kind of disease. The Boys are all swimming this morning two nigger Kiddies are Boxing & causing great fun. Colombo is very clean never saw a Fly even there, & the People a very superior class to the Gypos but great take-downs if you are careful. Thought that storm would cool things a bit but it didn’t. leaving this Afternoon about 4. Admiral Jelico coming here to day. Hawker won the £10,000 4 others killed. £76-9-0. £1-12-4. Gardens very lovely here. Bananas Ladies fingers 6 pence a doz at the Boat 4pence a bunch on shore. Another fearful thunder storm this evening Raining in torrents. Its Hell down here no air & the men who slept on deck all down here. Time we got out of this. Got Bananas Pine Apples & oranges all green given to us. Still up
Entry.317: Still here but expect to go this afternoon The New Zealand came in this morning with Admiral Jellico on Board also Jap. destroyer & a U Boat. 099. the Japs are taking home with them. Heat fearful again sweating away to nothing. £76-10-6. £1-9-10. the Capt. our Col/ & Dr/ inspecting latrines this morning, they are simply disgraceful Pay day Monday. Another Jap destroyer & U 55 came in followed by Jap. Cruiser British Officer off New Zealand gone on board to Pay compliments etc. U Boat 55 was a notorious Boat or its commander was if I remember rightly. Left here at 1-30 another storm coming up. all glad to get away at last took on 2000 tons coal & 100,000 Gal/ of water
Entry.318: fearfully Hot night heavy thunderstorm slept naked all night with this shower at 6 a.m. Heavy swell on but all seasoned sailors now. In another 4 days will be getting cooler weather cross the line Tomorrow. Will go into Quarantine for a week at Sydney 3 cases of Flu on Board £76-12-0 £7-7-4. Latrines cleaned out to day first time for 4 days & this at the Equator. left at 1-30 P.m. on Saturday.
Entry.319: a lot of men taken ill last night 60 to 100 of them down Dr going round injecting morphia all vomiting awfully. In charge of fatigue Party this morning crossed the Equator about 4 a.m. soon be cool again Sweating like a Pig £76-13-6 - £1-4-10 Pay day tomorrow.
Entry.320: getting a little cooler didnt sweat at BK. this morning are about 800 miles from Colombo. Gambling stopped of its own accord some days ago. W.D. last night, Pay day today sometime. £76-15-0 £1-2-4. Fremantle next Monday night. Heavy swell on Boat doing a bit of Pitching. Concert tonight.
Entry.321: Rain again last night much cooler now. good concert last night. not Paid yet. £76-16-6. 19/10 Paid 30/- in debt 49/10. choppy seas
Entry.322: a bit Rough, expect to Pass Cocos Island today some time £76-18-0. £2-17-4 getting lovely & cool. Sea running pretty high & water coming on Board Runs daily since leaving Colombo 1st day 245, 314, 320 300, 278.
Entry.323: Heavy & Rough sea on, feels like the switch–Back Railway all Port Holes screwed up till we get to Fremantle, seas coming right over. Yesterday our dinner had kerosene all over it. £76-19-6 £2-14-10 – 268 miles. Concert last night. Passed the Cocos Island last night about 8. Gale & sea worse. Guard issued with Rifles & Bayonets in case anything happens & there is a rush for the Boats.
Entry.324: Sea not quite so high but bad enough gale still blowing. Rumour that Peace negotiations are broken off & that all ships entering Aussie Ports are quarantined £77-1-0 £2-12-4. only doing about 11 miles an hour. wont get to Fremantle till about Thursday instead of Monday 288 miles.
Entry.325: 306 miles last 24 Hours got 814 to do to Fremantle. Sea gone down a lot but wind still strong & sea choppy. A lot of men ill. £77-2-6. £2-9-10. Am Posting letters & Post cards from Fremantle. Much colder today had to Put blankets over me last night, first time for a month. Passed ten Boats, one towing the other, last night. All the Awnings taken down.
Entry.326: still rough & windy. 306 miles yesterday £77-4-0. £2-7-4. had to put on singlet, underpants shirt & cardigan Boots & sox. A week ago was getting about in Pants only. 315 miles to day up to 12 noon
Entry.327: Heavy sea on & the first roll we have had wind still strong Medical inspection to day. Telegrams taken 2/- but not sending any. Letters to Nell, Syd, Viv. & Mrs Parsons P. Cards to Nell, & Boys. Fremantle tomorrow morning. £77-5-6 £2-4-10.
Entry.328: Arrived here Fremantle 3-15 a.m. Aussie at last. Band met us on the wharf when we drew up about 3 Pm. at 4 all were off & away I went to Perth (free to Soldiers ) had good time & had a fine welcome from the People. Put a lot of fruit & eatables down south & returned by 9-45 train getting to bed about 11-30. All Pubs were closed at Fremantle & Perth but some of the Apes got liquor & came home lively, what Brainless Asses some of these men are. Went to picture show posted letters to Family. Rumours that we are going to call at Hobart, funny if we do. £77-7-0. £2-2-4.
Entry.329: lovely morning Pulled out from wharf at 7-30 & anchored in the stream a lot of men missing. One tea shop we went into yesterday, said it was too cold for cold drinks & had only tea on & we were sweating. £77-8-6 - £1-19-10. Cost one about 7/6 yesterday & had a good time for it. What a treat to get amongst Australians again especially the girls. Aussie Butter, Sausages, & Fresh mutton came on board. Up anchor at 12 noon and at 6 tonight have done 87 miles average 14 ½ miles an hour. Good Bye Fremantle You gave us a Royal welcome.
Entry.330: wet morning 10 a.m. about opposite Albany soon be in the Bight & expect it Rough Pretty heavy sea running, much colder but better than the heat. £77-10-0 £1-17-4 374 miles. turned out Beautiful day but strong S.E wind.
Entry.331: Raining again this morning but not much sea very calm for the Bight. get to Adelaide Monday only staying about 2 hours so no leave. should get to Melbourne Wednesday night & Sydney Saturday morning. 24th. Not going to Hobart. £77-11-6. £1-14-10. 323 miles looks like dirty weather , Rain Squalls all day.
Entry.332: Rain squalls, Heavy sea & cold with strong winds S.E. £77-13-0 £1-12-4. 310 miles 36 5 to Adelaide 12 noon
Entry.333:
fine but cold sea gone down Kangaroo Island on the starboard side & Mainland on the Port

should be at Adelaide about 3 Pm slowed down a lot £77-14-6 £1-9-10. coming up Spencers Gulf now & its very smooth. 309 miles to noon to day.
Entry.334: got here Adelaide at about 4.30 came very slow all day engine trouble again we have medical inspection every morning thermon/ Put in your mouth Dr/ coming off to go through us here Up at 5. BK 6. inspection 7. Looks like heavy rain quite muggy. South Australians not gone off yet Been here all night, dam shame don’t expect leave. £77-16-0 £1-7-4. About 70 South Australians getting off here almost 80 West Aust/. got off at Fremantle. Left here at 3-30 Pm get to Melbourne about 3 a.m. Thursday.
Entry.335: Rain Squalls & strong wind again, getting along the coast, get to Melbourne tomorrow morning. Victorians & Tasmanians Paid this morning. Last concert tonight. YMCA sent us cigarettes & fruit yesterday 4 apples & 2 Pears each same as at Perth Good old YM. £77-17-6 £1-4-10.
Entry.336: Arrived here Portsea Quarantine Station Vic 9-30 a.m. Beastly weather Raining & windy like a fog. About 4 hours from Melbourne Get there this afternoon about 4. Drs/ just finished inspection We had a Lady Dr. Vics very excited £77-19-0 £1-2-4. On the opposite side of the heads is Queenscliffe. Got leave at the last moment for Melbourne. 4.30 Pm.
Entry.337:
off this morning at 8.30. Tom Cassell was down to the Boat, but missed him he left letter from 

Nell & Tony sorry I missed him they evidently expected me to get off here. Went to Tivoli last night, My Lady Rotten show. Got home 12 lot of drunks came home so got to sleep about 2. up at 6:30. get to Sydney tomorrow night. £78-0-6. £-19/10
Entry.338: heavy swell on wind behind us. done my last fatigue, felt doppy this morning 220 miles by 7-30 a.m. 350 to do, get in about 11 tomorrow. Paid £10-0-0 yesterday. £78-2-0 - 17/4. Raining all day heavy swell on
Entry.339:
outside Botany heads 10-30 soon be in now & the end of a Perfect voyage thank God. will have dinner-on Board £78-3-6 – 15/10

Paid up to 18/7/19 £89-5-8
